description:
The place is sweet and big, but I'm rating because the team is fantastic 
Nobody else is in that mood on a Monday morning, grabbing a coffee her this morning made my week start better.
author: Marina B.

description:
This location has, in recent years, become a cesspool of bums and weirdos during the late hours, whereas it used to be a clean, friendly spot for college students to study when I was in school. It mirrors the shithole this city has become, unfortunately, but Laurel Heights remains relatively nice, so it's kind of strange. I guess people flock here from all over because it's the only 24/7 Starbucks in SF. 

The bathrooms are filthy. On the bright side, I doubt the asinine new public bathroom policy announced the other day will affect this location. The bathrooms are tucked away where it's impossible for baristas to tell if people have purchased something. 

Speaking of the baristas, this so isn't the demographic I'm used to. They are highly unprofessional and rude, and they make the worst drinks around. As an aside, whose job is it to keep the store stocked? Are the employees tasked with reporting what they need on an average night? They have been out of essential ingredients every time I've stopped by lately, including last night. Like, how are you out of coffee base, and what is this repulsive replacement?
author: Paulina F.

description: Closed during regular hours should be bbn open but won't open doors. Lights on people in there
author: B H.

description: Thank you barrista who was NOT paying attention when you made my husband's drink. It was a mobile order with lack of quality control. Upon my husband finishing his venti matcha Frappuccino, he observed a large yellow cap. Thank you for the extra dose of plastic.
author: Cristina P.

description:
Open almost 24 hours! Busy during the daytime hours as well as the late night hours!
I would come here to study and write my essays that I procrastinated on during the day.

Seating can be very limited so sometimes you may have to wait to get a table especially if you are in a group or want to be seated near an outlet. At night you may see some questionable people but I have always had a great experience!

My college years were spent here with friends in the late hours of the night.
author: Nathalie M.

description:
As a long time customer of the Laurel Village Starbucks I wanted to express my appreciation to the entire staff who go above and beyond the call of duty and provide excellent customer service. The barista's learn customer's names and favorite drinks, and they are constantly hustling to get that hot or cold drink to each and every customer as fast as possible. They try hard to keep the store clean, even when customers do not clean up after themselves, and when someone is harsh about a drink made different than expected they promptly remake the drink with a smile!  Most important they have a warm welcome for everyone! Thank you Laurel Village Starbucks crew for your professionalism and courtesy, and for making all of our days better!!
Sandie P
author: Sandra P.

description:
This Starbucks location is awesome because it's in a clean, safe area, it's open pretty much 24hrs (according to the Starbucks app), and there's a ton of seating & power outlets! 

Customer service is NOT great.. But they do make good drinks, and they carry all the same stuff as the other locations, which makes it a really convenient place to stop in, or hang out at.

I went in a little after midnight & there weren't any seats available, this place stays packed!
author: Denise F.

description:
Best Qualities: 
 1. Very big size
 2. Friendly employees
 3. Lots of seating including a high top table that can be used as a standing desk.
 4. Lots of parking

Worst Qualities:
 1. They BLAST the music. I was actually shouting to my friend when talking to them because it was so loud in there...
 2. The parking has a 90-minute limit and they DO ticket you...I may have gotten one.. :(
author: Daniel C.

description: Ordered no whip cream... got it with the cream... asked to get new one... got the same one some of the whip cream out of it. In addition I was extremely polite.
author: Mert M.

description:
What a fantastic location and strategic to say the least.

On a block geared towards baby strollers, their nannies, and a drove of UCSF employees as well as the JCC, this Starbuck's is comfortably locked into a neighborhood where the locals and workforce will keep the profits here rolling.

While many place their orders online, I still take advantage of walking in because some days I'm not on a normal schedule and due to my finicky mind, may choose different types of espresso drinks depending on the day.  My favorite is their Caramel Machiato and Breve Lattes done extra hot.  I'm not picky and just order off the menu: full fat and full sugar.  

The layout of this shop is great and allows for good flow.  You can usually find space at the window counters around the front but I don't doubt that during the day, this place is packed people and their laptops.

Service is quick and efficient and served with a smile.  Right off the 1-California muni stop so easy to access.
author: Miika M.

description: This Starbucks is open 24 hours. Very convenient location next to a bus stop. Clean facility. Plenty of tables to sit at with power sockets to charge your phone or laptop. One of the best places to study.
author: U V.

description:
I was out in SF on a shopping trip ​and decided to drop by this location. Immediately​ I was surprised​ by the unique layout of the store. The furniture was all very nice and seemed to have a lot of care put into its maintenance. The leather chairs were especially comfortable.

This time I wanted something new so I asked the cashier for recommendations. Her eyes lit up and she enthusiastically named off her favorite drinks, some of which were custom creations. I ordered one and it was delicious and finely crafted.

This location doesn't lose a single star, everyone should go here! :D
author: Eliza H.

description: I am sitting here at 2am May 12 and the "baristas" are playing profanity-laced rap music on their cell phone speakers, or at least one of them is. Not sure who. But super unprofessional. Wouldn't really care much but the music is melding with the Starbucks-sanctioned music from the speakers and giving me a headache. Just play one or the other please. Or just play the music Starbucks has told you to play. This is not your DJ set. Wtf are these ppl doing? Someone needs to be given a warning. Would never come back.
author: Max G.

description:
This may be the worst Starbucks in San Francisco.  It's open 24 hours, it's a haven for homeless people and it's dirty.

If you want to sit next to a greasy 50 year old homeless man who leers at women and calls one of them a f**king whore and stands up and physically intimidates her while she's seated because she took out her cell phone and he thought she was going to take a photo of him, this is the place for you.  The same man left and came back (with all his gear) three times in the hour I was there late last evening.  One time he got up and stood three feet behind an 11 year old girl who was at the condiment bar, staring a hole in the back of her head with a grin on his face.  Just standing there looking at her.  It was beyond creepy.  

Then he ate potato chips and left crumbs all over the floor, as well as dirty napkins on the table.  In the entire time I was there not one employee cleaned anything.  

Finally he decided to clean out his ears with a paper clip.  This went on for 20 minutes.  He was grinning the whole time.

When he verbally attacked the woman she complained to the manager who instead of ejecting the man, said if she'd been assaulted he had to call the police.  So basically, management punted?

The police came and (I heard the whole thing) politely apologized to the man for the understanding then *suggested* he leave for a while.  He went out and stood in the bus stop.  The woman was still there when I left so I don't know if he came back in, but another woman I talked to said she's a regular and the man is *always* in there and is *always* leering at women.

And he's just *one* of the homeless regulars.

Please note that since the Starbucks incident in Philadelphia, the instructions have come down from on high - anybody may use the bathroom, anybody may sit in Starbucks all day without buying anything, and you practically have to punch someone in the face to be ejected.  Note that this man was not ejected by management even after a customer complained that he had intimidated her and called her a f**king whore.  The manager's solution to this was to come over and tell the man not to communicate with the woman any more then kicked it upstairs to the police.  Didn't even tell him to move and he was sitting right next to her!
author: Hannah T.

description:
I like going to this 24 hour Starbucks to study. Some of the baristas here can be really nice, and some can be rude. Sometimes you'll see people napping and being unproductive, like I am now. It's convenient because there is a parking garage at the back where you can park for free! There can be long lines and no empty seats, but it's a pretty good place to stay productive past 9pm, when most cafes are closed!

There are limited power outlets, so make sure that your laptop, cellphone or other electronics are well charged before you embark on a semi-productive journey.

The bathrooms are usually semi-clean but most parts of this store have litter or coffee spills. I still keep coming back because of their odd hours!
author: Charlene F.

description:
I really like Starbucks, but this Starbucks has the dirtiest bathrooms I've seen at any Starbucks. Not usable.  Wads of TP and filthy.  Looks neglected for days.  
Yuck


Staff is pretty nice though.
author: Paul G.

description:
Pros:
-Open 24 hours.
-A row of tables and cushioned seats with AC power.
-Standard Starbucks coffee and other fare.

Cons:
-Music is blasted too loud.
-Late at night the place is full of weirdos. I'm trying to work right now with a girl sitting across wearing headphones and loudly singing/whining R&B while rocking in her chair and snapping her fingers. There are also predator neurotics who roam from customer to customer trying to stir up very loud, weird conversations. Best to keep your noise cancelling headphones on although mine aren't good enough to block out the whining R&B nutcase. Is it too much to ask for a normal late night visit in peace for once?
author: Christopher S.

description: Saturday evening 8~10pm, quite some people here and their internet sucks BALLS. Keeps appearing and disappearing from the list of discoverable networks and when finally connected is so slow you can't even open the Google main page. The second star is for the barista that sat down with me trying to help me connect.
author: Alexandra T.

description:
The first time a coworker told me this place was open 24 hours, I thought it was too good to be true! Eventually I found out that this location closes down for a few hours to clean up? Come on!!! A popular coffee shop can't remain open without ever closing down to clean up!

I usually stop by for coffee and leave! Move along.
author: Julio B.

description:
I order my coffee from the cashier , Al, who proceeds to emit two sneezes the size of the state of Texas, not even covering his mouth.
    This is the SECOND time in as many days I have written a less than failing grade with this store. (The first being quite descriptive on Google...)
  Disgusting,  enough to contact the regional manager. If the guy doesn't have enough sense to cover his mouth when he sneezes, when was the last time you think he may have thought to wash his hands , not to mention change his clothes or brush his teeth ?
  I expect such disregard for cleanliness in Donald Trump's house , for example,  but not in SF. 
  The mice in this place are prolly in bed with a thermometer atm.
author: Vernon B.

description:
Compare to others this Starbucks is huge!  Lots of sitting room throughout the store. They also have multiple bathroom stalls a plus. 

Staff is friendly and efficient.
author: Wendy H.

description: They are not only not 24 hours, they changed their late hours however they like it. On New Year's Day, not New Year's Eve. They closed early at 11:30 pm without warning. I was here for coffee at 8 am and not see their manually generated sign on their back door till they are close! They are also not completely open till 5 am. They will say the bathrooms are still being deep cleaned and their facility are always broken regularly so if anyone else says they are 24 hours. It is not true. By the way the hospital emergency room across the street is not 24/7 either unless you are a child or pregnant and have to be admitted with doctor's recommendation so stop saying to people, go across the street.
author: Connie L.

description: This place is dirty inside. The floors need to be swept and mopped. The tables and chairs have food crumbs all over them. I don't even want to sit down. The counters need to be wiped down and the condiment station where you get lids and straws needs care. The trash Area there needs to be dumped. Also the women's bathroom is gross. The bathroom trash is all over the floor in both stalls. I mean is anyone in charge of the cleanliness of this place? With a Starbucks being unkept like this there really isn't any point in discussing the service.
author: Angela M.

description: Reconfigured! Big improvement. I'm a customer again. Love the iced black tea with pineapple.
author: Gina P.

description:
Did the store manager change recently? Staff used to be friendly but they know keep talking to each other. I was there this morning and there was a barrista (chubby guy) who was litterally shouting customer names in a way he thought was comical. Embarassing! In the meanwhile, at the cashier, another barrista (chubby young woman) was exchanging "funny" comments on customers with a workmate. 

Time for a little management shake-up at the store, IMO.
author: Emmanuel R.

description: I like this Starbucks because it has a parking lot in the back and the people are not as sketchy. I used to go to the westlake Starbucks to study but it has these sketchy people, one guy shirtless with a knife, some people staring at you trying to ask you weird things. I also like this Starbucks because it's open 24 hours. But the parking lot is great because lots of coffee shops in SF only have street parking and that's hard to find. Wifi is good. Ample seating. Nice and polite people. I also like this Starbucks because there are multiple stalls in the bathroom and the bathroom is very clean, doesn't look like people have been bathing there.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Come here to see who wanders in at an odd hour. Spoiler alert!!! Lots of interesting people!! One guy with a dog, another with a larger than life plush toy. A lady talking but not making any sense - the worker behind the counter very polite by the way. Lots of young people with laptops.

Good to know:
*Open 24 hours, I believe.  *Large - especially for SF standards, and very comfortable. *Bar area I like...  can watch the baristas making drinks. *This is a police hang out... *Lots of parking.

Its midnight. I'm here. A decaf Americano and steel cut blueberry oatmeal hit the spot as a midnight snack. I'm at the bar watching two young ladies and one young man hard at work. A group of people speaking a foreign language by the creamer. A lady and guy appear to be on a date behind me. A young lady in fuzzy comical  house shoes on a comfortable chair. She must live next door. I'm here writing this happily with a sense of purpose and will be back.
author: Stefan T.

description: A 24 hour Starbucks to do homework at! Pretty busy at night until about 12 midnight or 1, so hard to get a seat before then. Wish there were 24 hour Starbucks in my area or somewhere near me that doesn't require me to cross the bridge and pay toll.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Consistently the slowest and most unreliable Starbucks I've been to. They often indicate that mobile orders are ready for pickup, but then ignore you once you arrive and try to alert them that your drink order is missing.
author: Gregg M.

description: Filthy, full of creepy homeless people who practically live there. Hot chocolate so sweet and weak,  it tasted like milk with sugar in it, pastry tasted like gummy day old wonder bread with a teaspoon of raspberry jam in the middle. Only $7 for that culinary experience.
author: Alexandra D.

description:
Shitty customer service! The guys Miguel always talking to his co-workers and never pays attention to customers plus no greeting!
Most employees copy paste their couches attitude. Shitty crew.

I wonder why Starbucks company hire employees who will hurt their sales!
author: Yousef A.

description: Came in today and was blown away by the customer service! the barista, I believe his name was Miguel, took my order and was cheerful and attentive. he worked quickly to make my drink as well - and it came out perfectly. I would hire him to be my personal barista if i could. highly recommend.
author: Kelsey L.

description: Amazing place for Starbucks , open 24/7 anytime in the city they open , good service fast and clean
author: Ray M.

description: Since the last time I was here like 3 years ago,  it seems like this location  has gone downhill.  Dirty bathrooms and homeless sleeping inside on the seats. No thanks. Moving on to the next Starbucks
author: Jesslyn H.

description: The restroom is not coded, which is great.  But it stinks so bad!   Wish they clean it more or mask the smell.
author: Drew B.

description:
This is all about costumer service!!!!
Just ordered a banana cake last friday  morning and after waiting several Minutes and have costumer after me getting their order first.After  all that i have to asking: wait a minute,excuse me sir,can I get my cake please?? And the rude server coming,dropped off my cake on the table,didn't call my name and looked at me with  angry face,very upset  and just gone,Thank you sweet for a horrible service and I'll recommend you to stay home if you are not in a good mood ok!!! I'll give a nice reviews for this place to my friends and family to this Starbucks!!!!
author: Cyrillo N.

description: Just stood in line for 15 minutes for a salad that turned out to be frozen.  Waste of time and money.
author: Katherine Isobel U.

description:
So I've been here numerous times and I have had good experiences.

Today was the first time I have been in the bathroom.
Absolutely horrendous. Fluids all over the floor. The toilet devoid of any toilet paper. Just an absolute mess.

If the bathroom and image of the store is not a priority, it makes you wonder what the priorities are. Do they even wash their hands?

Big Smiles  and Starbucks standard coffee. Disturbing Hygiene. 

I will not be here again.
author: Norman R.

description:
came in tonight around 2:26 am,  and the asian guy working the counter was rude for no conceivable reason. he turned around and saw me at the counter and just looked at me, no hi can i help you, no nothing. he looked less than thrilled with having to work. i ordered alatte, paid, and went to wait. when my drink was ready he pushed it to me over the counter without even looking at me-like he was literally looking the other direction. im still thinking maybe he's  just having a bad night or hates his job.  but i noticed there was no whip and i like whip, so i said in a perfectly polite, friendly voice, "excuse me, could i get a little whip?" i wasnt mad, i wasnt annoyed, i judt asked for some whip... and he ::rolled his eyes at me::. i finally had enough and said "is that ok?" and he goes "yah sure" and adds the whip.

i dont know what his issue was, but his attitude was unneccessary. I'm still deciding if i want to speak to the manager. i dont appreciate being treated like that when i didnt do anything and was polite. who knows what his personal issues are, but theyre reflecting badly on Starbucks.
author: Mer L.

description:
AFWM couple every where. Straight Asian men here get stink eyes.

The coffee is ok though. Not the best I've had. Prefer Peets.
author: Ma H.

description:
The fact that this location is open 24 hours is wonderful! Great for doing work while I'm staying in the neighborhood. However, I've been here twice in the last two days, and had negative experiences both times. Yesterday I ordered a tall iced tea, and was charged for a grande. I told the cashier that I thought the tall was less expensive (as I was looking at the price on the board, which confirmed my assertion) and she straight up looked me in the face and just said "no, it's not." It took two or three minutes for me to get through to her, until she finally realized that she'd charged me for a grande, despite my already having the tall in hand. I feel like she handled this minor mess up very poorly. The 50 cents is not a huge deal to me, but the attitude was unnecessary, and the lack of accountability once she realized she'd made a mistake was very frustrating. The place was also quite dirty, and looked like it had needed a sweep for several hours. 

Today I went back in the early afternoon to order a quick snack and green tea, and while the people working were very nice this time around, they messed up my order and when I was on my walk home I noticed that they'd given me peppermint tea instead of green. Blech. So far not my favorite Starbucks.
author: Elise S.

description:
Starbucks has just finished remodeling and IT'S AWESOME!  Better tables, more space, tables with COUCHES!   If you want quiet study at the tables on the right.  Outlets, there's some facing the windows, and my favorite are the tables of the left with couches (outlets are under the couches).  They start cleaning the right side at 1am, and the left side around 2am.    
The staff here are really friendly even though they're basically pulling all-nighters working and they make an effort to get to know all the regulars.
author: Janine M.

description:
Alicia the cashier should get a raise! Despite long lines and a wait with impatient, rude, holiday guests, she still gave service with a smile and even offered to recycle my gift card with no balance. She is the best! 

Hope her manager or the company sees this and she is recognized. 

Merry Christmas Alicia! Keep doing it right :)
author: Christine V.

description: If there was a way I could give a negative number for stars, this Starbucks would have it.  Big issue here is, along with being the only Starbucks in town open 24 hours, this has essentially become a homeless encampment.  Sitting down somewhere and lounge with your drink is impossible since there are bums sleeping everywhere.  Most of them don't even have drinks to begin with, yet enjoy the usual essentials a paying customer would normally enjoy.  Using the bathroom is an adventure too! And the people that work here doesn't care, but then again, why bother sending the homeless off when you're vastly outnumbered and risk being shanked? On top of everything else, the wifi here consistently lags and when it does work, it's slower than molasses.  Whoever owns and manages this Starbucks should be ashamed of themselves.
author: Chris A.

description: I only come to this Starbucks because it is a block away from my doctor's office. But I try to avoid it if I can. Everytime I come here, I order my regular drink (same drink I order at any other Starbucks). But it doesn't matter if I ask them to double (or even triple) the caramel or chocolate in my drink, it still just tastes like milk. I don't even know why I bother with this Starbucks anymore.
author: Sarah H.

description:
I have been in many Starbucks to order my drink and today when i came in to THIS Starbucks, a red head girl was very mean. I order in Venti cup and she said "no we cant do that because people pour milk in there"

Hello, i dont need no damn MILK because i need a true COFFEE not a damn MILK. 

This is very unprofessional and lack of knowledge of her - the red hair girl to listen to a customer order. You need to learn more on every each customer taste.
author: Kristy L.

description: Awesome team! I asked for an item off the Starbucks Secret Menu (Chunky Monkey Frappe) and Will whipped it up with a smile on his dial. Fantastic study spot, 24hrs, safe neighborhood and friendly, skilled staff :) 9/10, would study here again!
author: Gia P.

description:
I do not think the employees are too swift.  Neither are the drinks or food.  Let me explain.  

I watch my weight.  So I asked for a large black tea, unsweetened, and also said "no sugar."  Went home with it.  Poured it over a larger cup of ice, the way I like it, tasted it, and it was sweetened.  Yuch! 

A couple of weeks later, this past week, I went back, made it clear again, "unsweetened, no sugar."  This time, I watched the young girl take the black tea,  shake it, good, then turned around and pumped what looked like a clear liquid, syrup, into it, and I said, " no sugar!"  She said, with another young girl right there watching and not contradicting her, "It is syrup, not sugar."  I said, "that is sugar, it is a sweetener!," incredulously, the other girl still silent as she tried to argue with me.  She finally threw it out and started over.  

U-N-B-E-L-I-E-V-A-B-L-E!!!

The guys at Peet's Coffee, also in Laurel Village, got it immediately and were rolling over laughing when I recounted this to them!!!!!  One of them, who is also a prep chef, and had worked at this Starbuck's for a couple of years, described the dumbed down equipment used.  I believe it.  I am an architect who does restaurants.

The drinks are way watered down, on top of it.  And for someone like me with Celiac disease?  Nothing with gluten in it, I have to go gluten free.

I will pass on Starbuck's always now.

Added later, and took a star off ----- 
When I heard Starbucks's was going to hire 10,000 illegals instead of Vets, I threw my hands up in the air.

The reason college graduates cannot get a job or one that will pay them enough to pay their college education loans back is because the elitists are using the illegals to drive down prices.  That is the bottom line.  Frankly, it's evil to the core.

So Starbucks, you just put yourselves on the side of the elitists.  And you are losing masses of us.
author: Janet C.

description:
Just wanted to add an update that if you get hungry and don't want to pay $5 for Starbuck's measly non-nutritional breakfast sandwich, head up the sidewalk to Cal-Mart next door open Mon-Sat 7am-8pm & Sun 8:30am-6:30pm and head to their DELI section where they make tasty decent-sized deli sandwiches for $7.  Be careful shopping in their regular grocery section since they ARE more expensive in this upscale neighborhood.

I forgot to add also that you can BE FREE of those long lines for your drink by downloading the starbucks app at www.starbucks.com/coffeehouse/mobile-apps for your mobile device.  You select this branch where you'll pick up your drink and their menu is presented to you on your mobile screen and then you order & pay on the mobile device and then your order goes straight to the barista who will have your order ready by the time you get to starbucks.  I usually pay with my app if I see a LONG line which NEARLY ALWAYS happens here at this popular Starbucks.  The only problem I have with the starbucks app is it takes up so much memory over 150MB.  You can increase your memory by buying a mobile SD memory card for your mobile device to hold your large docs(including music, videos) to make room for the starbucks app, but hey, to avoid waiting in 2 hour lines, it's going to STAY on my smartphone and I'd rather delete the other apps!!
author: Frugal C.

description:
So this review is long overdue!  I find it funny how I've been coming here for years since I work at the hospital down the street, how much the staff has changed in the last 6 months or so. I usually come here after a shift around 9 or 10pm sometimes... this is usually a busy time because it's when the SFPD night shift usually starts.  Regardless , every time I come here with co workers or just by myself I think it's the manager ..or supervisor, an older black woman has taken my order and every damn time she does not fail to have the worst and the most sour attitude with me. It's like she has a personal grudge with me. I know I have not done anything to her but wait my turn and order in the most polite way. I have witnessed her treat other customers like shit as well.  I have witnessed her berate a customer because english was not his first language. Smdh...starbucks should be ashamed to have a person like this on their staff!  She is rude, demeaning , and flat out doesn't give a shit how she is treating the customers. I mean we are paying for the drinks and she does work at Starbucks. She's not the owner and she's definitely not better than us. So how about you just do your job! And pretend to be friendly for once !... if you hate the job that much, don't work at Starbucks where you have to interact with people every day. I'm so sick of her attitude and have stopped coming here unfortunately.  I hope they get better staff and remove this rude and careless person, she should not be working in a customer service job....bitch should be working where she doesn't need to interact with anyone. 

And no, it's not always open 24/7 this same woman has kicked me and my party out around 1am before .
author: Coraline J.

description:
This is probably the best Starbucks store you can get in the city. Large store, lounge chairs in the front, communal and single tables in the back. 

If you need to work I suggest to walk towards the back and grab a table over there as this is where the outlets are located.

Patrons are a mix of students, locals, and the occasional weirdo that is part of every San Francisco neighborhood. Parking can be found on California or on one of the neighboring small streets.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Best Service in one of the busiest shops in Town.

Need to clean the bathrooms more often; too much funk in there
author: Craig B.

description:
This place has gone downhill. 

Clean the restrooms every 30 minutes. Trash in stalls should never get to the point of a pile on the floor. Find a way to fix the men's toilet for the long-term. Mop/sanitize the floor if an overflowing toilet is leaking enough to run under tables where customers are sitting, especially if multiple customers have reported it.

Lock the back door so that it is only an emergency exit in the evenings or get a security guard for the back entrance. When a thief can grab a backpack from a customer and run out through the back door then you don't know how to do security.

Keep coffee bar clean and stocked by checking it every 30 minutes (hopefully not by the same person cleaning the restrooms). 

This is a great location with plenty of customers, but if you cannot keep it clean your customers will go elsewhere or corporate will replace you with staff that can do their jobs.

The only reason I gave it a whopping two stars is because they are open 24 hours and they have divided sections for quiet study, relaxation, and talkative small groups.
author: Jackie J.

description:
OK, its a Starbucks, so five stars is relative, don't expect gourmet food or five star table service.

That said, this Starbucks is head-and-shoulders above the others.

There are three registers, so they get you through faster (less waiting for your caffeine fix) and it is very nicely decorated, with a number of comfortable seating areas, so the place has a nice look and feel.

I would not drive across town to visit but if you are nearby and needing a cup of Joe, it is worth stopping by.
author: Gary A.

description:
Sorry, mint/chamomile/herbal tea. You get boring after awhile. 

Sometimes you just gotta live it up. So I got the cafe mocha WITH whipped cream. Fattening, no nutritive value, foamy ... cream. MMM.

Other MMM things about this Starbucks: it's newly remodeled and the flow is more open with lots of seating now than before. Plus, it's OPEN 24 HOURS. Wait, what? yes, you can look it up on the website to verify that or call like I did just now. The barista wasn't amused when I said, "you're really open 24 hours?!" and he said  "yes, we are ..."   yawn. Oh hunny, looks like someone needs coffee.
author: Janice C.

description: Morning Joe. Busy place but they have enough team members to move the line fast; super fast!
author: Austin L.

description:
Very nice friendly staff and efficient customer service. Thumbs for being a 24 hour coffee shop here in San Francisco. Whether you're in need for a bottle of water, cup of coffee or a place to use the restroom at 12 am? You can count on Starbucks!

Starbucks Coffee have their own brand of Kettle Style Potato Chips?
Breakfast Sandwiches available at 2:00 pm?  Seriously? Props!

BRIEF REVIEW UPDATE FROM 7/3/2013:
This is one of the Starbucks Coffee Shops with breakfast sandwiches available during lunch and midday. If you want to be able to get a bacon or ham breakfast sandwich, come in during breakfast. I came in between 12 pm - 3 pm, and the only breakfast sandwiches available were the sausage ones.

Overall, good selection of food and beverage menu items. Friendly staff and efficient service so I'll definitely be back when I am in the area!
author: Bennett W.

description:
I don't normally rate coffee shops, but heck this is an all hours store that caters to the medical staff at CPMC and all the students nearby.

It is the community concept that all coffee locations desire.  You'll find people doing business or studying at all hours.  Mix that with pre-natal mommies and others and you have a pretty vibrant location.

Downside is that it is pretty busy and studying while coffee is grinding is probably pretty annoying.  I've had a meeting or two here where people obviously listen in (so we make up stories).  

Its a great location for me and the closest coffee shop to my home, especially when the Peet's down the street closes early.  Always nice to go for a walk with my gal and grab a cup of coffee after dinner on a cold night.
author: Erik H.

description: Nice option for a late night coffee/tea and place to journal, work, or catch up with a buddy. Arrived on a saturday night around 10pm and was greeted by a friendly barista. My cousin and I sat for an hour and I left happy that we found this spot. I'll be back.
author: Kristy F.

description: Worst Starbucks I've ever been to. Rude staff, slow, and unprofessional. It's too bad, because it's a great and busy location.
author: Gale R.

description: 4 stars for cashier, 2 star for cleanliness since people do not clean up after themselves and staff is super busy with so many customers.  2 stars for the bland seating area of brown. 5 stars for verona coffee. 5 stars for free parking in the back. 5 stars for 24 hours, 5 starss for all them windows.
author: Helen L.

description:
I've refrained from writing reviews on the various Starbucks unless a particular store was worthy of a shoutout.  

Imagined my surprise today when I entered from the back parking lot.  Hmmm, the tables alongside the wall have been rearranged.  More lighting, more tables and chairs added.

Then I approached the front and I noticed that the coffee line has been reformatted. The communal counter that used to block traffic has been removed and more overall seating area. Remodeled store for the better.

I'm feeling happy with the improved changes.  And most happy when the barista gets my name correct!  What a great way to start my day as I'm headed to the dentist with my latte in hand.
author: Shirley N.

description:
It's tough being a 24/7 business, tending the draw the homeless crowd in with warmth and bathrooms.
The baristas were quick with their service and occasionally did a precusory sweeping around the store.
It's a decent place to study with lots of table space but pretty crowded even at 11pm on a Saturday. Outlets are also in short supply. But I can't knock down any place that provides caffeine at any hour of the day so 4 stars it is!
author: Tina K.

description:
Have to update my review, since I have come back, and each time has been better.  Yes, some people are still rude space hogs, treating place like their office/living room.

But the staff works hard and they're great, and it's a nice option to have nearby.
author: Geri C.

description:
I just came from this location and my experience was literally so bad that I have to write this review. It's not a particularly busy Thursday night and only one man was waiting in line in front of me. A red haired woman, who I'm assuming was a manager, started reprimanding an employee right in front of customers and other employees. She was unnecessarily harsh, telling him something along the lines of "hurry up and leave when you're off because when the customers see you in your uniform and you're not working it irritates them." I don't wanna tell you how to do your job but what we probably find irritating, if not extremely inappropriate and uncomfortable, is having to be present while you embarrass this kid in front of us. After apparently dismissing him, she said something under her breath and looked visibly irritated, which kind of made the atmosphere uncomfortable and awkward. After that a customer in front of me had some sort of issue with her order that she was also upset about. The worker at the register next to that situation that was in no way involved decided that he absolutely had to stand there and ear hustle instead of take my order. 

ALL THIS FOR A DAMN CUP OF PIKE PLACE.
author: Jessica M.

description: Restrooms are are always dirty. If you are not a regular customer the staff is not friendly.  Ask for a cold beverage with lite ice and my cup was also filled half way with ice!!! I don't like to send foid vack so I took it and left the store disappointed!
author: Yolonda H.

description:
I love this Starbucks. It is open 24 hours...and always has someone sleeping (drool seeping out one side of their mouth) with their laptop on...at 5 in the morning.

The people that work here are amazing: The most friendly, down to earth, and competent people of ANY Starbucks I have been in. Their Doppio espresso starts my world in the right way.

If I am snoring to loud in the morn...please give a gentle nudge and put my laptop on standby...thanks in advance.
author: David G.

description: BEWARE: OF WIFI FRAUD -large area, very friendly staff, but while I was here today using their WIFI my credit card information was stolen and charges rapidly started accumulating. I did not charge what I ordered. I paid cash. The fraud started somehow while I was using their unsecured internet. IT WILL TAKE DAYS TO UNDO.
author: linda l.

description:
I stopped in on my way to apartment hunting. There were two baristas behind the counter, one asian guy with earrings and a slight buzz/mohawk, and another guy with a long ponytail. I only mention their descriptions because these guys were super friendly and awesome. They were attentive to customers who were coming in, they didn't rush anybody. These guys were also chatting with each other while restocking and stuff, and just having a good time. Good vibes when the workers are happy.

I ordered a tea, and asked for a recommendation. I got "Joy" tea, which is a mix of black, green, and oolong tea. When I got mine, it was piping hot. It smelled so good though. Good enough, that I bought one for the friend I was about to meet. She loved it :)

This table I sat at was not cleaned, and there was nobody sitting there. There is a lot of space, and on the side, there were a bunch of small tables that were all taken. I don't go to starbucks often because I don't drink coffee, but I had a good experience here. 

I often return to places that have great service, good vibes, and/or great food. I may or may not be back to this particular location, but I will keep it in mind!
author: Kaje Y.

description:
I recently realized that Starbucks has been a part of my everyday life now for over ten years.

Over 10 years?!

Through the years, we have gotten to know each other very well, & our relationship has just grown & thrived.  Today, we are as strong as ever.  

So, I would like to just say a few words...

Starbucks,
When we first met, I didn't like you at all.  I certainly did not think of you as a potential relationship, since I did not care for your seeming disregard for the small business man.  I thought that you were self absorbed & selfish.  I didn't trust you.  So, understandably, I kept you at arms length.

And, seriously, your being from Seattle did not help matters any.  I'm a San Francisco snob.  Even worse; a North Beach snob.  We NB'ers drink espresso imported from Italy for chrisake.  Who the (bleep) is "Starbucks" from Seattle to show up here & who does he think he is?  What kahunas!  We turned up our noses, & oh...how we laughed.  You were mistaken for merely another interloper; not the first, & surely not the last.

I figured you would continue your feeble attempts to lure me to you, & I would just continue to blow you off, & then you would be on your way back to Seattle.  And you would be completely forgotten.

How wrong I was.

I can't put my finger on the exact moment you started to breed my interest instead of my contempt; but I do know that once you got me to turn that corner...I never turned back.

Professionally, you proved your integrity by the way you value your employees, contribute to your communities, & work to sustain & prosper our valuable resources.

Personally, you impressed me with how you are always there for me whenever I need you.  Day or night.  Even all night sometimes.  And it doesn't matter where I am; because wherever I happen to be, there you are, too.  You're always receptive & accommodating.  You always listen.  You have always happily put up w any requests I have.  When I switched from low-fat to nonfat lattes, then to soy, then back to nonfat, then back to soy again...not once did you so much as bat an eye.  And all those times I couldn't decide if or what I wanted to eat, you were always just as patient as could be.  When I wanted low fat, you gave me low fat.  And when I wanted organic, you gave me organic.  It seems that you just love making me happy!  Seriously, I've annoyed myself on many occasions.  But you?  Never.  What's more, you're always accountable for your mistakes, & you always make up for them.

I can't imagine my life without you.

It is for these reasons & more that we are still going strong.

Thank you times a million.

Faithfully & forever yours,
V.
Xoxo
author: Veronica M.

description: Went to get my drink and the lady with the red hair (clearly matches her devilish soul) was not helpful whatsoever. My order was clearly to hard for her to comprehend (clearly she lacks knowledge) so she claimed she couldn't do it. Every other Starbucks makes it for me. Kate, Ray and the other African American male deserve 5 stars for their helpful serves but lady with the red hair doesn't even deserve one.
author: Nicole C.

description: I'm only giving three stars because of the young African American gentleman at the register, he assisted my friend and I with no problem. Now let's talk about the unnatural disgusting red head who hates her life, job and shows it. My friend goes to Starbucks everyday and orders the exact same thing. The unruly red head was beyond persistent with telling us she could not make the order because we might dump our drink and pour milk into. She then goes on and says it's policy while she's telling her coworkers to not make the drink.  How inappropriate and unprofessional of her to not even attempt to make the drink. Will never be coming her again
author: Rasheda S.

description: I posted a picture on "add a photo". There are two trash holes right where you dress your coffee and a canister right beside it for recycle and compost. All four openings were overflowing and left like that for the two hours that I sat in the lobby. Everything else was fine but that right there deserves one star bc I have never seen this before at a starbucks and it is completely unacceptable. Disgusting.
author: Tiffany J.

description:
This is the Starbucks I frequent most since I work blocks away. I've always had wonderful service and most of the staff is super friendly.

Out of all the experiences I had, today is the most noteworthy. Where do I begin? No greeting, no sort of feeling ackowledged. When I ordered, the cashier never made eye contact with me. When I made one drink order, she assumed I was done ordering and tried to rush me along. I was trying to order 2. I asked for extra room in the coffee (didn't happen. Had to dump some out myself in the trash...such a waste) and for lite whipped cream on my cocoa (also didn't happen). She ended our interaction with "thank you, you can move along and get your drink at the other end of the bar". Cool...I've never been told to "move along".

It would've been nice, considering the holiday season, to be treated like a human being. I understand that it is busy but a second of acknowledgement is just that, A SECOND! And that one second is enough to leave a lasting impression, good or bad.

If you choose to work in food/drink service it is part of your job to acknowledge the customer. Otherwise, maybe work somewhere else if you don't care for human connection.

I wish I remembered her name. Started with an M or N. Will update when I go back
author: Camilla G.

description: They just revamped this Starbucks and it looks like a European cafe lounge.  Nice ambience with a big lounging area and areas to hook up your computers and work or study away.  I love how there's always a long line here yet the service is always friendly and superb.  I think the people waiting in line gets aggravated sometimes but who can blame them for not having their morning coffee yet.  This is a 24 hour Starbucks so you get an array of students from all over town coming here to study and socialize on their breaks. It's a great place to people watch and just enjoy your lattes.
author: Sharon N.

description: I really liked Cynthia and her service and the handsome, tall, blonde gentleman.
author: Tyler A.

description:
A 24 hour Starbucks within walking distance of the hospital your child is staying in seems like it would be a huge bonus.....well not if it's this one. I was so disappointed! 

The location was fairly clean, but that's where the good stuff ends. I was here multiple times at different times of day. The counter sandwiches were never stocked....maybe 1 to 3 sandwiches at any given time in the cold cases. Juices and other cold beverages were sparse as well. The baked goods counter was also very lightly stocked. Each time I ordered my drink, it was made differently, never tasted right and never tasted the same way twice. It's so disappointing!!! 

The kicker is, that out of 12 employees I encountered, only 2 were even close to friendly. The rest acted as if the customers were an annoyance. I'm glad to be home and back to my regular Starbucks location!!!
author: Laurie S.

description: Liv and amber are the best baristas Iv ever met in my life. They got all 15 of our drinks perfect. Had awesome conversation. We're fast and amazing. I love them
author: Angelina P.

description:
I typically go here from 11pm to 4am as I'm a night owl and this is one of the only 24-hour places in the city.  Generally there are two different groups of employees.  One group is awesome.  They're friendly, fast and thoughtful.  The other group is not as great.  Particularly the manager who tends to be grumpy.  For example, when you ask customers to move to the other side of the store so you can mop the floor, that's fine, but why do you have to yell at customers who don't immediately understand you or didn't hear?  I understand that a decent percentage of customers at night are "characters" who might be difficult to work with, but it's not acceptable to yell "excuse me sir but no you don't" across the room to the grad student (who later I noticed was ESL) who had his headphones in when you originally mentioned it and was about to sit down.

But hey, it's late night at Starbucks, so what can I expect?

update: Went there again and that same manager was rude.  I ordered an iced tea and forgot to say "black tea" and she gave me this dirty look and held the silence for a second and then snapped "I can't make it for you if you don't tell me what kind".  I would just assume that it was her style of communication, but I notice that she treats the other employees much more nicely.
author: Erem Z.

description:
Have to say, first off, that the two staff I dealt with came off as friendly and helpful. The place was clean and well-stocked with pastries, etc.

Here's my problem:

I always order a Venti Chai Latte with 7 pumps, no water, no foam, and I specifically ask for WHOLE milk.

The barista's first attempt tasted thin and barely sweet. So I requested a redo, which was graciously given. He even asked, in a friendly manner, what was wrong with the first attempt for the purpose, I presume, of satisfying his customer. I explained, but it turned out not to be enough. Unfortunately, the second one was only slightly sweeter than the last, but no where near as good as I've had it done by so many other Starbucks baristas.

I decided not to try a third attempt as it would only serve to frustrate both me and the barista.

Now, when this has happened before, maybe 2% of the time, sometimes I'm told that I should ask for eight or nine pumps, or that WHOLE milk diluted the sweetness.

The other 98% of the time, other Starbucks baristas get it right the first time round (and on occasion, the second time round), with only the same instructions to go on.

In this case,I had left a pre drink tip of $2. This time round, they only deserved maybe 50¢.

But it's these little human errors - at any given place - that makes one choose to go to the competition for his next few lattes, in order to wash out the flavour of customer dissatisfaction. Then, one returns for another, hopefully, deliciously made to order latte at good ol' Starbucks.

But until then...
author: A.R. M.

description:
I like that they're open 24 hours.

I like that it's always crowded, no matter what hour you walk in.

I don't like that it's always crowded, no matter what hour you walk in... there's never anywhere to sit, unless it's near the restrooms :( 

The staff is nice, too.  I don't think I've ever had to have them remake my beverage.
author: Kristin H.

description:
Totally LOVE this Starbucks. I come here whenever I am in Laurel Village to see my Doctor. I always stop by here. Seating is plentiful. The bathrooms are nice. There is an entrance in the back as well as front of course. This Starbucks is also open 23 hours if I'm not mistaken. 

I have to say that this is the most expensive starbucks it seems. The staff are sure to charge you for even the slightest pump of syrup or condiment. That totally gets on my tits be other than that Im a fan of this one.
author: Julian I.

description: Horrific experience this morning, walked in an open door at 3:30am to get coffee only to be verbally assaulted by an employee who demanded I leave because they were performing a "deep cleaning" I pointed out that their signs, and website indicate they are a "24 hour Starbucks", the employee yelled at me that she told her district manager they have to be closed from 11pm to 4am and I had to leave...very hostile, very confusing and false advertising....never ever going to a Starbucks again!!!
author: Jo B.

description:
First if all the service in this Starbucks has totally gone downhill. I will be making a report to their corporate office. 
I came in tonight and purchased a $6.45 Ham Sandwich as I often come here for coffee or both. One thing is it's too bad their crew always changes. Well after my purchase I had to badly use the bathroom. Had to wait 10 mins. then the employee TYLER cleaning the bathroom told me another 10 mins. I asked him if I could use the men's room since he was done cleaning it. He said no cause the floor was wet. I asked if I could use the ladies room since he hadn't started on it yet, and instead of accommodating me, he said NO cause he will be mopping the floor then it wouldn't be ready for another 10 min. after that. I asked the girl infront and she said just to tell the guy. I explained that I really needed to go. I'm a diabetic and when I have to go, I gave to go. I expressed to the other employee that I had a urinary problem. I had to explain my medical issues so I could use their bathroom. It was humiliating. I have never been subjected to this kind of humiliation in front of other customers ever!!!!!!
Exasperated, that TYLER comes up to me and starts saying things to me about the bathrooms and his cleaning but what reverberated in my head was when he said IF YOU REALLY NEED TO GO, THE HOSPITAL IS NEXT DOOR! 
WHAT KIND OF CUSTOMER SERVICE IS THAT? To INSULT ME EVEN MORE BY TELLING ME TO GO TO THE HOSPITAL???  Would you say that to a pregnant woman? I am a customer. I just bought my overpriced sandwich. REALLY? CORPORATE YOU WILL BE HEARING FROM ME!
I am not not one of the bums that frequent t this Starbucks , as a matter of fact far from it. The nerve an audacity to mock me of my medical problem! HOW DARE YOU TYLER! I WANT THIS KID FIRED !
author: Debbie S.

description: If you want to wait over 20 minutes for your drink while everyone who ordered after you receives theirs, then this is the location for you.  Unhelpful employees who lose your drink, and tell you that you'll have to wait another undisclosed amount of time to get your order because they "have so many drinks right now."
author: Christina S.

description: Lines here are almost always (the dozen or so times I've been here) extremely slow. Couple times I've just left because of the unusual wait. I love the atmosphere though.
author: Brian W.

description:
You know..the think about coffee is that you need it 24/7. Not just to cure your morning headaches related to a lack of your caffeine fix, but also for those sad scholars trying to make their college tuition mean something. Which is exactly why I love the "California Starbucks" which is so conveniently located on California Street and so conveniently open 24/7.

They just recently renovated the place, so it is much more open and is now featuring even more spaces for you to study, chat, or read a good book. It also has a ton of outlets, which is so necessary seeing that 90% of people sitting here are on their electronic devices (I'm guilty too). 

The bathroom has two stalls, which is beautiful and unheard of in any Starbucks, but Cali Starbucks is special. 

The only downside is that parking is kind of a drag. There is a designated lot, but it's only 90 minute and there isn't much all day parking in the area, just a bunch of 2-hour parking. On top of that, everyone working at CPMC California tries to snag all of the good parking. 

Whatever the case, Cali Starbucks has all of the sugar, caffeine, and open hours you need to live your nocturnal life, so I'm definitely glad that it exists.
author: Cara O.

description: 5 stars because this Starbucks is open 24 hours and has ample space for working and/or studying. I spent plenty of all-nighters here while I was going to school in California. Wish there were more 24 hour Starbucks, but I get that it's only worthwhile for Starbucks to stay open all day in larger cities with more foot traffic.
author: Connie N.

description:
THE LAUREL HEIGHTS STARBUCKS HAS REOPENED.

As expected, there is slightly more room, and about 3 or so more electrical sockets, but it definitely looks clean, sleek, and spiffy now.   There is more light in the back corridor area where the seating expansion occurred, and the bathrooms are now *unlockable* (which is atypical for a Starbucks), and the bathrooms can accommodate multiple people at a time.   No more will people hog the bathroom to themselves for hours doing who-knows-what.    Definitely not friendly to homeless people trying to take a bath at the sink now.  Before the upgrade I also saw a fisherman with a pole and fish bucket leave the bathroom just before I entered, and there were fish scales clogging the sink and fish guts in the trash can.   I doubt any of those creative uses of the bathrooms will occur now.  Thank God.

Also as expected, the wifi is still painfully slow.  It's AT&T wifi.  No upgrade there.  I clocked the wifi in the uncrowded store, (uncrowded because many don't yet know it has reopened), at 2.23 Mbps down, 2.84 Mbps up.  Once it gets crowded again, expect it to drop to 1 Mbps down and up, or if it has a lot of heavy bandwidth users, 0.5 Mbps down and up.   For scale, streaming *one* HD video won't need much buffering at 2 Mbps.   So close all your web pages if you want to stream a video.   Expect to continue to hear people complain about the wifi being "dial-up" speed.

But for those who must have a late night Starbucks with fast wifi, I noticed the Dublin Starbucks (In the shopping center off of the Hacienda Dr. exit) which is open to 1 am every day was recently upgraded to Google Starbucks wifi.    It is also a very big store with plenty of shopping mall parking.   It might console a few of the aggrieved that the Laurel Heights upgrade doesn't include decent wifi.   The Dublin store is probably the closest Starbucks with both late night hours and fast wifi that you can actually park at for unlimited amounts of time as well.

(And actually, since the Dublin store is larger than the Laurel Heights store AND has Google wifi AND has vastly more parking...I'd rate that Starbucks higher.   But like the Laurel Heights store, it is also tends to get packed with people day and night, ...students and mall goers, but fewer homeless).

Not sure what commenter "Amir" was smoking when he reviewed, but Laurel Heights has quite a few homeless camped out there most of the time.   Police are frequently called in to roust them as they try to sleep on the couches in the evening.   There is also a loud schizophrenic who often tries to hang there, but he shouts out scary stuff so the police are usually called in to boot him as well.   But he always returns.   The homeless problem in fact is likely one of the main reasons for the remodel....so the baristas can monitor both entrances and all the seating more easily.   The expansion in seating is, by comparison, minor, and by itself would not make much of a dent in the seating issue.
author: Trevor C.

description: The best experiences with the entire Starbucks company by far! Ara was very personable and courteous. In the San Francisco area this personalization of service is really hard to find. More quantity focused than quality. I had questions about the new bagel "batam" (stuffed bagel of some sort) she provided comedic reviews and great recommendations. I love my drip coffee very creamy. Like, more cream than coffee and she priced my coffee to fit that little bit of information, which I love. Because, college tuition.... If the manager is reading this. I have never visited you location but because of Ara I will make sure to stop by. She works hard and has a very happy disposition while at work. Her smile alone is infectious. Invest in the right people! With that said give that girl a promotion!
author: Quincy T.

description:
The guy making my drink today was really friendly and made sure my drink was made how I wanted. The cashier was nice too. 

The place was clean and the service was fast.
author: Emma M.

description: Had some time to kill so we stopped at Starbucks and ordered two hot chocolates.  I told the cashier no whip on both, but he failed to write it on the cups.  When the barista called out our order, I saw there was whip cream in both so I told her that we said "no whip".  Instead of her making us new ones, she just casually scooped out the whipped cream in both cups.  Aside from that, my hot cocoa was extremely sweet!  No bueno!
author: Candice H.

description:
4 stars because it is 24/7 !! Come on man!! The coffee is good too. 1 star less because sometimes it is packed I mean most of the times which makes sense and there are some frequenters that get annoying, I mean they talk and stuff, not a biggie. I'm visiting anyway, wi fi acts up sometimes, only good signals you get around the corner close to the bathroom, sometimes people make a mess in the bathroom, sometimes people talk loud, I wish it was twice the size it is right now ! :) maybe next time I'm visiting SF ...

UPDATE:
It looks like that wi fi covers the whole place now not just that dungeon dark corner next to the bathroom! I'm so happy now. Thanks SB. last weekend they closed around 12:30 am. Maybe they're not 24/7 anymore? Sunday 7/26/2015
author: Majid D.

description: This is regarding the bathroom. I walked in and quickly walked out. It looked like bums had been bathing there for a week. Truly disgusting. Made me question the drink I ordered as well.
author: Dennis K.

description: I ordered a small coffee and sandwiches. I stand up and waited for a long time until I finish my sandwiches and I asked where is my small coffee. And the one who make coffee just give me the one at the counter but that is not my name on it. When I open the cup that is not coffee, so I complain and another lady just begin to make one for me. Terrible customer service. Don't go again.
author: Yelp W.

description: Word to the wise:  this is a very busy Starbucks.  If there is a line, it is not out of the realm of possibility that you might wait 30mins for your latte. Definitely preorder if you are in a hurry.
author: Nan B.

description: I come to this Starbucks very often whenever I need a place to concentrate and need to work/study long hours - especially during the night. It may be hard to find a spot if you go on busy hours but I never had a problem about that as I usually come around 12-1am. Staff is friendly.
author: Ilke A.

description:
Dude they should do a 20/20 special on this specific Starbucks! 

I've never seen anything like it anywhere.... and it's changed my life!

It's 24 hours, and every one of those hours this place is packed with people working and studying!

Freaking awesome!!!
author: Nolan M.

description:
I come here very often when I am doing long walking jaunts around the entire City. These usually last for a good solid half day's time, and the kidneys are fully functioning... where better to stop off than this excelente Starbux, to both refuel and micturate?!

a POPULAR joint/location.. open 24/7, almost solidly smack dab in the midle of SF. I'm a big believer in all that is offered here... cannot wait for Monsieur Pascal Rigo to work his wonders with the pastry case, and am very much waiting with baited breath to see what the future holds. 

PS can you please start selling croissants that gives Tartine a run for its popularity?
author: Jana C.

description: Got my usual apple cider from this Starbucks. Same experience, the menu looked different than usual. There's a big parking lot in the back, so don't find metered parking.
author: Denise C.

description: A smooth running machine. The staff are uniformly professional and friendly. There's no place I'd rather wake up to.
author: roger m.

description: All workers are friendly. Except the manager , her name is Wanda , a rude master . I felt very frustrated.She treated one of my friends "a foreigner with strong accent "very rudely and with bad attitude.
author: Walid T.

description: I only come here at night when I want to get out of my apartment and do some homework. When I come the service is always the worst out of all Starbucks locations I've ever been too. I might be grumpy too if I were doing graveyard shifts, I don't know. And it's always a miracle if you can find a seat. The place is always packed until well after midnight so good luck.  Starbucks needs to make a few more locations 24 hours so we aren't all fighting over this one and Westlake.
author: Nick M.

description: What's going on with Starbucks?  There's this extremely rude lady named Wanda there. My goodness. How does she still have a job at this place. I read other reviews about how this place is going downhill and that is extremely accurate. I use to come here daily but no more. How do these people get jobs? Who's doing the hiring?  I don't even want to waste more time writing about this place.  Left me with a bitter taste.
author: Erick M.

description: Open 24 hours a day which is nice. Lots of inside seating for working.  Very spacious.  Offers a good variety of snacks.  Staff was meh. Granted I was there at 2am but overall a good experience.
author: Lynsey S.

description: Parking convenience is great! Staff is friendly and experienced so the line keeps moving. With volume of customers it can be at times messy but it's literally always packed!
author: E H.

description:
Two stars because my mocha cookie crumble came out perfect.

However this is to the cashier with grimy dirt under his finger nails and just stared me down until I actually came over from waiting in line to order. He has a ponytail and CLEARLY did not seem to care at all for I repeated my order not twice but three times before he got it right.

1. Call me over nicely and politely if you are ready to take my order. Customer service was clearly not there, I noticed much more because as a retail worker, I know how other workers in customer service act when they are doing a less than up to par job.

2. Your grimy ass nails make me want to throw up. Do you even wash your hands? How do I know my drinks and snacks are not getting contaminated by what's growing (and clearly thriving) under those finger nails. You are pathetic.

And what truly set me off, I ordered THREE gift cards for my friends and he took them and threw them on the counter like nothing. Excuse me, I am paying for those and I do not appreciate having what I bought thrown around like that. Had I more time, I would have made a scene and called the manager. 

Needless to say, this man who assisted me at the cashier is an embarrassment to the Starbucks chain. I am disappointed Starbucks hired this man. All other workers I've seen have been welcoming and wholesome except for this man.
author: Melissa V.

description: Absolutlely my favourite Starbucks in the city. Store is noticeably larger than most and contains tons of seating and work areas to be productive . Did I mention it was 24 hours?!
author: Eddie Z.

description:
This Starbucks is always so crowded.  There's never anywhere to sit!  

It is nice that it is open late hours though.
author: Alison L.

description: It was a busy Friday morning at 6:30 AM at one of the busiest Starbucks in the city. The line was to the door. Once I paid the cashier I walked out to my car  just outside, to grab my cell phone. I walked back in and looked for a place to sit; found it and before I could sit down my quad espresso was ready. That's fast!
author: Jonathan S.

description:
At 11pm, we needed some caffeine fix and heard about the 24 hour Starbucks at Laurel Village.  Since we were in the Richmond District, we made the drive to check out this Starbucks to get our cup of Joe.

Street parking was not an issue.  This Starbucks was large quite large with many tables and some couch seating.  I guess with this being probably one of rare locations open so late at night, every table was occupied and just about every person had a laptop. 

One good thing was that only one person was in line to order.  We ordered decaf coffee, but the cashier said they didn't have any brewed, but they could make some with their Clover coffee drip. Cool!  We heard about the Clover and that only select locations had it.
The coffee was so flavorful.  In the evening, many Starbuck locations will make an Americano for the decaf and it does not taste nearly as good as this Clover drip.

If in the area and in need of some coffee late at night, this Starbucks will be my "to go" location.  Just don't count on getting a seat or some pastries or dessert as the case was completely empty.
author: Al L.

description:
These two stars are given because of the appreciation to the store manager.

The story was my daughter ordered the Very Berry Hibiscus thru my iPhone app. Her order included 2 scoops of the berries. When she got her drink, she found that there were only 2 berries in the cup. Then she told the black lady who made the drink about this. But that lady said it showed 2 berries on the order. My daughter ordered this drink many times in different Starbucks and never got issue. We opened the app and tried to find out if my daughter ordered two berries instead?! But it did show "scoop". We tried to show her the phone and she totally ignored us.
I told her that I wanted to talk to the manager, and she just pointed the guy at the cashier was the one. She kept showing "Not care" on her face. What kind of customer service it was!! 

Luckily, the store manager understood the issue and made her the replacement.
author: Gemini L.

description: This is the best place for someone who have office / school work to be completed with a feel of coffee. I usually have cafe mocha. It's awesome and I won't even mind spending the entire day here. Why I should not like a place where I can get my things done that too with a coffee ?
author: Pratik J.

description:
The cashier looks like he doesn't want to be here no smile whatsoever sheesh don't like your job just quit

But guy preparing the drink was awesome
author: Shakeel T.

description: Props to the hard working folks here, got here on a Sunday St. Valentines Day, packed!  The weather was nice and they are working.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I thought about giving 3 stars, but decided to give 2, but really, they only deserve 1. 
I have been coming here for many years. Not very frequent but steady as I love to go to books inc. then come here to rest a bit after buying books and visiting banks. 
I agree with other people, the service here had really gone down hill! What's wrong?
Last week I ordered two latte, and asked for Sth with a handle  to carry it , as I have other things on my hands too and can't use that tray thing they put out.  The guy making the coffee kind of abruptly said " over there". Ok, so went to the cashier. I waited until one customer paid and left, I thought because I was obviously here earlier than the next in line and was holding two steaming hot coffee, I should be served first? no! The girl told me to wait bc she wants to serve the other person first. I went to the next cashier when that one was freed up. I paid for the "bag", as they called it, but found out they gave me a regular shopping bag! How do I suppose to carry two coffees  in a shopping bag? After some more explanation  and rushing around they did found Sth to hold the two cups. Then I went to get the shopping bag. The girl who refused to serve me asked the girl giving me the bag If I had " paid for the bag"? The girl answered "yes, it's paid". She's kind of embarrassed to answer that question. What did that girl think? I would steal their 0.10 cents bag? !
I have to say services every where are going down hill. those young people, they don't care.
author: madeline m.

description:
This place is nice but they need wayyy more seating if they want to be a 24 hour place. Almost the whole store is taken up with displays in the front. So my boyfriend and I had to stand around drinking our coffees basically in front of the counter. 

Plus the baristas were super rude to us! We paid together and they asked if we wanted our receipt and I said no, why waste the paper right? But then when we wanted refills they loudly said they wouldn't give us refills without the receipt and that was store policy. I don't understand why she didn't tell us this when we she asked if we wanted the receipt. The girl who took our order was nowhere in sight to back us up that we had literally just bought these cups like 15 minutes earlier, and we were shocked at how defensive they were about the policy when they had already explained that it was enforced loosely. We especially didn't understand because they must have seen us literally standing right in front of them as we drank. It was pretty stupid, but we eventually got refills and left. Just really embarrassing to be treated like bums in a very crowded Starbucks.
author: Meghan E.

description: Always busy but service is fast and friendly.  Recently remodeled now has a long bench and new configuration that allows more additional capacity.
author: Nessa M.

description:
I'm not rating this Starbucks for their coffee and it's taste... I'm giving this location 4 stars for its 24 hours feature and the accessibility of parking.

Also, I've had the fondest memories here with my best friend when we were back in college... didn't know what to do moments so we ended up driving up and just hanging out and having those conversations of "what if's" 

There's been a lot of cops around here lately at night... but I guess that's good to keep the peace and quiet inside. Also, the baristas are friendly even if they're working 24 hours!
author: Cath M.

description:
Your standard Starbucks that plays jazz in the background and packed with everyone from the kid who just got out of school to the octogenarian reading the newspaper in the corner.

This place is packed with college students from USF as well all on their laptops (apples more than pc's as expected).

Lots of room and table space but it's always so packed that you may not find a chair.

Supposedly open 24 hours but as some people have said this may not be true...but I can't confirm as I've never sat outside watching.
author: Julia P.

description: The service at this Starbucks has gone completely downhill. I work in the neighborhood and I'm there 3 nights a week, getting coffee and sandwiches. Recently there has been a change in personnel, resulting in long lines and risking being late to work. 9/21 was the last straw. Myself and my co worker, both Rns waited over 20 min for our order. The poor barista was obviously new , and in the weeds. The shift manager , a stout redhead, was stocking and laughing with the cashier. I finally asked, could I just cancel my order I'm late to work. The shift manager responded with "'she's doing her best, we're busy or something to that effect. I then said why aren't you helping her and this unleashed a barrage of back and forth where upon I learned that this is the 3rd busiest Starbucks in Northern Cali, and that she, the shift supervisor her job was to stock pastries for the morning " or people won't have anything to eat"... Umm , that's not my problem, and I actually said " you're handling this very badly". Did I mention the place was packed? And this interaction was taking place over a counter in front of everyone?I'll spare the details but it's interesting when I look at the other poor reviews, this redhead is mentioned as being rude, and the manager I spoke to this am said she was " recently promoted"! And while I'm on this epic rant, I've also had poor interactions with the infamous Wanda! She is rude AF! I mean blatantly. At first I felt bad for her being middle aged working nights at Starbucks but that quickly faded when I was treated badly more than once by her. I work with the public, I know it's difficult and I respect the barista jobs, but I can save 6$ and make my coffee at work in a keurig. Totally done, not going back. I'm sure they won't miss my money because " we're the third busiest Starbucks in Northern California".
author: Anne Z.

description: Love the service and staff calm and friendly!  Keep coming in when we are in town.  Love their food and coffee
author: D M.

description:
Can this place get better WIFI?  Come on starbucks add a little data to your internet plan.  

Staff = awesome.  Hours = great.  Seating and outlets = pretty good.  WIFI = 56k dialup


If you are going to accommodate 2x or 3x more people than an average Starbucks then  have the WIFI to match it.  Good luck if you're trying to study or get work done here.  Forget about streaming a song or video!  Just sit there with a state of the art laptop and fire up Notes b/c thats about all your computer is good for..
author: Eric V.

description:
I play video games enough to know how to really put someone's wifi to the test (starcraft II) 

And comparing how they each turned out at the same times, this location has more space, more conveniently placed outlets and strong wifi signals. This is now my go to place...for all night drinks.
author: Eric C.

description:
This bucks is huge..open 24 hrs is a plus but its seriously always busy, no matter what time of day!
Can be hard to find a seat.
Nice ambiance
There's a code to use the bathroom.
author: Linda T.

description:
24 hours.  what's not to like about that?  I hate working alone and its nice to be around other awake people at 4 in the morning.  I wish it was closer to the bay bridge so I wouldn't have to drive though the hilly part of S.F, but oh wells.  

There is tons of seating here.  Outlets are a bit more sparse but in the later hours of the night it's not much of an issue.  The wifi isn't very strong.  Night staff are very friendly.
author: Mason T.

description:
Sit by the handicapped table with your phone out (don't hate, all the other seats were occupied) and a thief will magically materialize, charge through the door, and snatch your iPhone from right under your face and then with magical cheetah-like-speed and strength, sprint down the block into a get-away-car! Eff!! Don't say you weren't warned!!

On a more + note, the coffee was just fine.
author: Raymond Y.

description:
As a fellow partner, I found this store very nice.

Of course, like many Starbucks, you may find the obstacle of finding a place to sit, looking at a smudgy pastry case or even possibly, a slight spill on the condiment bar, but you'll find that at any cafe.

However, what impressed me was seeing that there was consistently a barista out in the lobby cleaning the condiment bar, tiding and restocking the retail wall.

Greeted by a partner (I believe his name was Gene), my sister and I came in wanting just a couple drinks. After ordering a mocha and my sister grabbing one of the new Evolution juices, I felt that he definitely treated us with a genuine welcome. 

Occasionally, the transaction process can be uncomfortable, however, he continually attempted to strike conversation, discover exactly what we wanted in an efficiently and in a timely manner.

He was definitely one of those partners who I consider as someone who truly embodies the Starbucks mentality, someone who invests in creating inspired moments, which is the very reason why I love going to Starbucks, enjoying their drinks, eating their pastries and even now working for them.

That's why I wanted to share my appreciation for this particular store.
author: Aaron G.

description: Spacious, great friendly staff and Clover brews available.  Win?  Yes.
author: Eric F.

description:
Open 24h, google wifii, good service specially "John".
Only bad thing is that sometimes it's too cold. Also it would have been nice with power outlets by the couches
author: Amir S.
