description: This place is great for studying if you could find a table. It gets pretty packed. It is a lot nicer since they've renovated. Customer service is great! They give out samples sometimes. There is 90 minute parking in the back. WiFi is weak unless it is in the back near the restrooms.  The only drawback is that there are vagrants and druggies that come through here, some of which use the restroom to clean themselves up. That means the restrooms can be pretty dirty, but this is also due to heavy traffic and many non-homeless people don't clean up after themselves so vagrants aren't entirely to blame.
author: N N.

description: Large place. Drinks seem to be consistent with other Starbucks. Sometimes hard to find a seat. But....WHY IS IT SO COLD ALL THE TIME????
author: A. E.

description: It gets busy busy in here! Lots of students camp out here, fyi. The place is spacious, but packed. Love that there's a parking lot in the back for 2 hours. And plenty of outlets, too.
author: Suji C.

description:
When you need to get sh*t done, and you're down to the last few hours in the middle of the night, this particular Starbucks is a good place to go.  Even if you don't really have anything to do, and just want to stay up...for the sake of staying up, this Starbucks is probably the place for you.

Open 24 hours, they can definitely help you get your caffeine fix to avoid falling asleep in the wee hours of the morning.  Parking is ample, whether it be on the street or in the rear parking lot, so kudos for that.  Just don't bank on always being able to find a seat; they've probably tried to arrange everything so they can maximize the number of chairs and seats, but it can still get tough because of its popularity.

The baristas are cool, and they've never messed up with any of my drinks.  Great place to just chat with friends or to people watch during the day...and to test your limits on how long you can stay awake continuously.
author: Mike L.

description: Absolutely love this location. It's pretty much always open, and you know it's a safe location because there's always cops hanging around outside. There's a good amount of seating and plenty of outlets for studying. Professional staff, you can tell they're used to working fast and dealing with all kinds of customers. And most importantly, my drink was delicious! Great job guys.
author: Miranda K.

description:
Great location, great 24h service and spacious. Although it can be pretty busy at some times, it is possible to find a place to sit at.

Best to go early in the morning or after 8pm if you want some peace.

Only con: wifi is really bad/slow.
author: Robert M.

description:
As I prior employee I give this Starbucks five because it has the most heart out of all the stores I've been it/worked at. Workers are fast, nice and genuine. They go the extra mile for this store and the team.
To those fools who just wander in one night not knowing how this Starbucks works: the floors are mopped EVERY NIGHT so EVERYONE has to change seats, don't be surprised about it, be grateful that there is a place open so late. The people that work that shift have it rough working 8pm-4am. Show some respect before you write a review of the whole store based on your own ignorance.
author: Noemi S.

description:
I use to have a friend that use to be a manager here in the late nineties and that was way before they remodeled it.
I think it is more open and you have more privacy &
The walls and floor and surfaces are all smoother now.
Alot of cops come here: 24-7
Hospital workers: early am
Middle a school age :after school 2pm
College age students :cramming late night 11pm- morning
They have new smoothies 
Thats what i ordered here compared to my normal 
Nonfat.    Soy.    Decaf.      Latte.   
I got the Green one with exta kale and protein 
But i recommend if u get one 
Get one with fruit so it is more sweet
Mine was fine but i like sweet things 
I just got that one cause k wanted less calories 
It was super busy as usual when i came here a couple of days ago in the afternoon
I saw cops.
Middle school age kids
Business meetings(mini )
And people on their laptops.
The best thing about this one is 
( if they r on their old schedule is)
That they are open 24-7!
All others close at night and iopen. Back u p at 5 am.thats another reason so many 
Hospital -cops- and college kids come here.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
I have died and gone to my 24-hour room heaven.  After experiencing the 24-hour room in the library at Davis, I was so happy to find a place to do work that wasn't a room full of crowded desks and fluorescent lights with life-drained students.

What I really like about this place is the open window-walls.  It allows a lot of light, easy people watching/distractions, and makes the place feel open.  The service is exceptional - all the baristas are happy to make your drinks, do any accommodations, and let you sit for hours on end.  There is no rush feel that some coffee shops and other starbucks have.  

This place is definitely made for work.  The way that the tables are placed, tables of different heights, couches, outlets everywhere - they make it so that it will be as comfortable as an experience as you can get while doing work into the wee hours.

There is also a nice neighborhood outside if you want to get something to eat, walk around, or go grocery shopping next door.  It definitely is in a lively neighborhood.
author: My An V.

description:
This location tops the list for customer service. 

I used to be a regular here, but now only visit sporadically. On my now sparse visits, I'm still recognized and welcomed as if I were still popping in on the daily. Love that.

The staff are ALWAYS friendly and personable, even in the wee hours in the morning, when everyone's either still groggy or in a rush to get to work. They're great conversationalists and well, just plain old good people. Gene/Jean, who I assume is the manager, is awesome. He always greets me by name and hooks it up from time to time. 

The drinks are well made - no complaints there. Baristas are more than willing to adjust drinks or fix them if improperly done (which is RARE). I've seen them assist pickier - and sometimes, even rude - patrons, still with smiles on their faces. That's  great work ethic, exceptional, even, and I appreciate that. 

Thanks to Laurel Heights Starbucks for always being quick, efficient, and most of all, being a great team!
author: Nicole I.

description:
Parking in the back?  Thumbs up!

It's a pretty spacious location, and considering it's open 24 hours, the place is really clean.  Friendly staff too!
author: Gina J.

description: I like how it's big and all.. There's many seats but there's not enough plugs for all those seats .. And the hand driers make SOOOO MUCH NOISE!! .. You could hear that thing across the continent .. Like who thought having handriers was the best idea ?? They don't even dry the tears from my face after hearing them every 3 mins ;(
author: Alexis B.

description: Park in back! This is a great bucky's. Lots of parking, lots of WiFi. One side of the place has no electrical outlets which makes it quieter than the other side where people are having a mini-party around a computer and the others are trying to do their homework. Good overpriced coffee, just like anywhere else.
author: Kevin F.

description: It's Starbucks. What else can I say.
author: Brandon M.

description: I like this Starbucks. The staff is really nice. It's a great place to do some work for a few hours. Internet is reliable and it doesn't get too loud.
author: Midori H.

description:
My go-to Starbucks! Reliable as it is open 24/7, staff is laid back, friendly, and know how to move the line along, they have a Clover, and there is plenty of seating. Unfortunately this location is not secret and many have made this their hang out spot, so seating is hit or miss. Wifi becomes incredibly slow when you can count 10+ laptops in use, because that means 30+ devices could be hogging the bandwidth. Don't get me started... 

Nevertheless, great location, plenty of street and lot parking, comfy couches, and other factors make this a great place to work or relax.
author: Lana L.

description: I think a human being can get reincarnated before you can even open a page in your browser with this wifi. It's that bad. I'm not joking. Who has this kind of wifi at this age. You will not get my money or any students money for this bad wifi.
author: Maya A.

description:
I'll go ahead and give it the full complement of stars despite the fact that it is always packed and can be hard to find a place to sit. The reason for the stars? There are a TON of outlets, almost every single seat is genuinely comfortable, it's clean, the staff is nice, they don't harass you for camping a table 4-8 hours and only buying a single hot tea, and also the people who frequent this Starbucks.

You get a lot of people obviously working, a lot of students - even those who are really loud and giggly don't bother me as much here as in some other places. You can ask someone to plug in your laptop charger without them glaring at you, and you can feel comfortable leaving your stuff at your seat to save it while you go to the bathroom without feeling afraid someone will run off with it.

Open 24 hours is SO AMAZING since I live above a bar and am quite sensitive to noise. So when I need to get out of there, I know I can go to a comfortable place with nice people, free internet, and reliable drinks.
author: Amanda P.

description:
Simply the best Starbucks in town. 
I've been going to this Starbucks going on 8 years now. I've seen plenty of staff come and go, and they've all been over the top excellent. I've made some good friends from this place. 
They always are friendly and are prompt on getting you your drinks on time and exactly how you want. 
It can get a little busy, but that's just because of the location. The best part - they know how to function calmly when it's over crowded. Lots of places haven't mastered that. 

Another plus for being open 24 hours!
author: Carlos R.

description:
The best starbucks I've ever been to. Not only are the drinks great, but the staff is AMAZING (Hi Gene, Nick, and some other guy that I never knew the name to!).This is the only coffee shop I've frequented where several staff know you by your name and always greet you with a smile and say Hi. The staff also seem to work great together; always smiling and they seem like they are having a good (yet busy) time. I work close by so it's a highlight of my work day when I get my drink there after lunch.

I will be moving soon, and one of the first things I thought of when I decided to leave was: I will miss this Starbucks and its staff!! It makes me sad thinking about it. Hope I'll get to visit again when I'm in SF.
author: Vivian L.

description: This Starbucks is like a party. I've never seen Starbucks employees having such a fun time while helping a tons of customers.
author: Shane R.

description:
In terms of customer service, it really does not get much better than this. I know each and every one of the staff members I've had the pleasure of interacting with has been fun, pleasant, and put a smile on my face. This location is ALWAYS busy with people and they're able to keep the line moving! They know what they're doing and they enjoy what they do!

 What prevented me from giving a 5th star is that I find the tables to be messy and in need of being wiped down; with the amount of people coming in and out I can see how that might be overlooked. This isn't going to prevent me from coming back, though. I enjoy doing work here. Thanks Starbucks! Keep doing what you're doing!
author: Tommy C.

description:
24 hour Starbucks?! Definition of the BEST Starbucks I've ever been to! However, be aware that you'll have to wait for seats and swoop QUICK. I'm usually pretty polite but if a seat opens up, I usually just take it because who knows when the next one will come up! 

It's a good place to study!
author: Connie Y.

description: Came by for a quick cup of coffee, on a nice cold and rainy morning.  Definitely some interesting characters, which reminded me a lot of Santa Monica... I think the 24 hour opening probably attracts them to this location.  Friendly employees, and surprisingly quick service.  Makes a good combo with Noah's for me... :)
author: Steve L.

description: I was just told the bathrooms were closed after I bought something and confirmed at the counter the bathroom was available. The mens bathroom was backed up and although the manager (at least he acted like the manager) hadn't actually said the women's bathroom wasn't working, he closed it anyway saying his "pipes were backed up". It was an emergency and he still didn't allow me to use it despite the alarming look on my face that I was about to pee myself. I was very tempted to dump out my drink, go in the parking lot and refill it with pee then leave it there. But I am a lady after all. The kind folks at Pasta Pomodoro next door saw my panic and let me use the facilities. Now that's customer service.
author: Caryn M.

description: Clean bathrooms, friendly service, full baked goods selection even at 4:00am. So thankful for this place. My new pitstop for Uber Shifts.
author: Monique M.

description: It is just a starbucks but having a place that's open 24 hours is amazing.
author: Dana C.

description:
Having woefully miscalculated my arrival and departure dates, I found myself without a place to stay on a Monday night. I could have begged a friend or spent $20 at a hostel, but instead I spent $20 and the night at what seemed to be the only 24 hour place in the bay area with wifi, seating and outlets. It went okay. 

The bathroom code is 559. There's an outlet on the ceiling, right above the chairs/couches by the window at the barista's right. 

There's a graph of seating availability and internet speeds over time here ( http://i.imgur.com/FLizO.png ). Field notes here ( http://pastebin.com/heEfNc4A )
author: Michael F.

description:
Not your average customer friendly Starbucks usually generated by the chain, albeit this location pumps out your beverages like toothpaste, which is remarkable considering the amount of consumer traffic this 24 hour location receives.  This is sole reason I gave them a two star rating.  
Once, I got through the few customers waiting beside me I ordered an Iced Hibiscus Tea and I requested it sweetened.  I want to note that today will be my second time requesting this drink and it will be my second time because my girlfriend liked it and wished for it.  The cashier had pleasant cordial personality while this younger gentleman with a shaved head and a ponytail,  who assisted the cashier, on the other hand did not.  I'm guessing he perceived my request as foreign with the lost look he shot at me.  He said something else with manner of a cocky connoisseur.  I just replied "if you can make the hibiscus tea sweetened then that would be great."  My order came out and my girlfriend approved.
On a side note, I saw the same guy with a shaved head and ponytail pull out a plastic container clearly marked "LOST AND FOUND" from underneath the front counter and went through its contents without justification.  If that's not enough to make you wonder or think twice about leaving your stuff behind, then what happens next will.  This guy reached into a bag from a container I must remind you is clearly marked "LOST AND FOUND" and stuffed what appeared to be a wallet INTO HIS POCKET!!!  I hope and pray this is not someone else's belongings and I am giving this shaved head guy the benefit of doubt.  Just something to consider.  Secure your belongings!!!
author: Manolo F.

description: This review is strictly towards "WANDA". She was probably the only RUDE barista i've ever encountered at any starbucks. That might sound a little exaggerated, but it's the truth. I fully understand that starbucks is by far one of the few places that has a constant high. BUT as an employee at any hospitality joint you have to always maintain a professional attitude towards customers. (speaking from experience). ANYWAYS, Before I even had a chance to approach the counter while I was in line with my mom she literally yelled, "NEXT!" literally, as if we were across the room. So we approached her and she didn't even give us the chance to think as she immediately said, "What do you want?" in the sassiest attitude. I asked my mom first and my mom's not sure so she says never mind and as this is happening i see WANDA straight UP roll her eyes at my mom. SO I tell WANDA my order before her eyes roll all the way to the back of her head. She said the price took the cash didn't even repeat the order, nor ask if we wanted a receipt. Just gave the change and said next. I CAN'T EVEN..... Luckily it was Christmas or I would've went off on her. Sass to me fine, but not my mom.
author: Pj A.

description: Open 24/7!! Used to go here to take my breaks between shifts. Easy access to bathrooms in the back.
author: Princess Kate R.

description: Avoid after 5 PM. Jam packed with too many kids 'studying' with expensive MacBook Air laptops and iphones and headphones on for affect, trying to look cool, while buying nothing. Depressingly sad. Never enough seats for real customers, students sitting there for 6,7,8 hours at a stretch each, this place has the atmosphere of a examination hall or the written test section of the DMV. Only other people who use it are cops and taxi drivers because of its 24 hour status. Why the management tolerates these students deterring paying customers really is a poor reflection on Starbucks.
author: Elton C. O.

description:
As an update to my previous review. I was sent a generic sorry letter from Starbucks corporate and 2 free drink coupons. Which was nice. But then approx 1 month later I got a message from the new manager, with a personal apology, and an offer of some more drinks if I would come back and try them again. I also got an update that he was no longer employed there. 

I have gone back several times and have been very happy with my experiences. I have gotten high quality drinks & service, exactly what I expect from Starbucks. And it's great that they are open 24/7 (except a few hours late Sunday night/Monday morning)  And I'm very impressed with the way things were handled.
author: Venus S.

description:
Staff were all super friendly and cheerful even though we walked in two minutes before their weekly four-hour cleanup closing. Barista even laughed politely at some dumb joke I made. 

The place is generally pretty busy (seems to be the only all-night coffee shop around), but it had lots of great seating options and looked very clean, too.
author: Crys L.

description: Employees running their mouths loudly non-stop. Can't hear myself think. Sounds like a high school hallway or MTV Real World in here. Manager needs to have a talk with his staff.
author: Hugh M.

description: Saturday mornings have gotten much worse here the last few months.  The line is always 20+ people long and the staff is very inefficient.  Usually I see just 1 person making the drinks, with cups lined all along the counter back there.  I've been going here for 2 years every Saturday on my morning break from work, but now I'm always late getting back.  Nobody seems to be in charge at this Starbucks and it's pretty chaotic.
author: Nic P.

description: An unusually large interior and the fact that its open continuously make this Starbucks a go-to location. If you're driving there is plenty of parking available - not like the Marina or Cow Hollow - jeebus.
author: J T.

description: As you're probably already aware, this place is open 24/7 and that's the only recommendation it really needs. Do you know how hard it is to find coffee shops that are open 24/7 in San Francisco?? I'm currently slaving away over a startup and as a result I spent 90% of my time taking advantage of free wifi in coffee shops while downing sugary lattes (glamorous, I know). Came here for the first last night, stayed for a few hours. Ordered a caramel macchiato, which is actually the only Starbucks drink I ever get. It was fairly lively at 12 AM Sunday night/Monday morning, which I guess means I'm not the only one in SF who has no real life outside of work. There aren't actually that many outlets, which is kind of annoying, but I managed to make it work. It's fairly spacious. Other than that, I don't know what to say--I mean, it's a Starbucks so you already know pretty much exactly what's like, but it's open all the time which is awesome. I wish it was more conveniently located--I really don't like having to Lyft 10-15 minutes to get to Laurel Heights--but otherwise no complaints.
author: Ava H.

description:
Quite frankly, I think that there should be way more 24-hour Starbucks. I absolutely love this one-- I just wish it wasn't so crowded and difficult to get to, if you don't have a car here in the city. 

This place is awesome. The environment, especially in the evenings is great! When the older, retired crowd starts to move-out around 4:30 or so, the college/grad students start to linger in. It feels like a campus college cafe where students are free to socialize, but also eager to get work accomplished. It's fun because you see law students, nursing students, and undergraduate students who are all studying for some type of upcoming exam. For the most part, everyone is really friendly. Even the people who work there are super respectful and outgoing. They enjoy the interactions with their customers and are happy to greet you. (or at least pretend to;) Everything from the mellow music, to the lighting, to the seating arrangements-- there is always something that someone can appreciate. Another bonus, you don't have to worry about the homeless trying to get money from you (I mean, come on, most of us are way worse off than the homeless since we are mounds and mounds in debt) and you don't have to worry about their lingering odors; which is really nice. 

Oh, and another perk, it's really nice when they come around and give you free samples. Free samples always cheers you up! :)
author: Fawn H.

description:
Once upon a time was a college student at Berkeley I worked at a coffee shop nearby. It had barely any open hours, and cool clients and I couldn't stand dealing with them.

This place caters to the ass hats of my neighborhood - laurel heights yupster moms and bratty usf kids. AND it's open 24/7 .

Yet the staff has never lost their shit, in fact they are somehow way happier and nicer than their green aprons would leave you guessing. Probably the worst place to work and yet the least disgruntled staff.

Boo on the clients, boo on no chairs ever and boo on the line.

But hurray to this staff, 24/7 access to ... Well anything in the small town of SF, and it's location.
author: Aria J.

description: Not going to shoot this location 5 because its packed like crazy with kids. If your showing up early no problem but after 9 forget it.
author: Michael M.

description: The wifi is absolutely terrible. You can't even connect to the access point! I'm assuming when you do, it's at a crawling speed. The general manager is totally ignoring this problem, I'm assuming. If you need to get work done, don't come here. Go to Pete's up the block or just use your cell data; as slow as that is, I'm sure it's much better than this poor service.
author: Hector O.

description:
Overall a great place to come at night and study. Big Starbucks, but is easily always crowded. Friendly staff. and people don't mind staying all night to do work.

Semi-slow internet per every Starbucks, and a few regulars who either stink or come in here to sleep. -___-
author: Shock S.

description:
I will start by saying I am kinda a hard man to please.... I have a weird way I like my tea.

I ordered an Earl Grey on Ice. The person behind the counter gave me a "Piss off" look and said we only serve it hot. I decided I would explain in 1st grade terms what I wanted.

1. Grab Vente Cup 
2. Put ice in said cup
3. Put Hot Earl Grey in said cup filled with ice
4. BAM... You my dear have just invented an Earl Grey on Ice

Next time please address me as Sir when I enter!
author: Michael B.

description:
They have Clover Coffee!!

If you don't know, Clover is Starbucks new drip coffee. It is a must-try and available only at select locations.
author: Jess C.

description:
I LOVE how this starbucks is 24 hour. A LOT of studying space here. There is also a parking lot in the back which makes everything soo much more convenient! 
Unfortunately.. I have to give this place 4/5 stars. They always seem to be running low on the pastry selection! How can I drink my coffee without a cake to go with it??
author: Annie T.

description:
This is a really popular spot, especially for students, so if you're coming at night, good luck finding a spot.

That being said, the coffee's pretty standard for Starbucks, but at least the baristas work fast and efficiently. This Starbucks is huge and is a good space to do some studying if you're lucky enough to find a spot. It gets crazy when school gets out or at night when people are pulling all-nighters.

Otherwise, I recommend this Starbucks over most. Atmosphere is chill and the layout keeps it from feeling cramped.
author: Raymond B.

description:
Open 24 hours in a location that very convenient!

The Positive:   the employees are friendly and will remember what you order pretty quick; you can park in the lot right in front; not too crowded late nights; very convenient location. 

The Negative:  Very hard to find seats. Seems like people never leaves their seats.
author: Anthony V.

description:
It's dependable, the location is pretty convenient, and the baristas are always friendly.  Often the music is played unnecessarily loudly, and finding a seat can get pretty tough during rush hour, but overall it's worth the risk of having to wait 5 minutes. 

It's probably best for studying, but can work as a place to catch up with a friend too. Watch out, around 3pm (on weekdays) the place gets a little crazy - schools out! So all the kiddos come in for their fraps. It's sort of cute though... so don't complain.
author: Zoey S.

description:
I LOVE THIS STARBUCKS. they lie about the 24/7 though. they're closed for an hour or two on sundays in the wee hours of the morning, just saying. i've gone there when it was closed and it was quite heart breaking. 

caramel apple spice, enough said.
author: Bianca W.

description:
After sitting down for about 15 minutes, this Starbucks decided to close the section I was sitting in for cleaning. It seemed a little arbitrary and I discussed it with the barista and she didn't care. She also wasn't interested in helping me relocate across the room somewhere. She essentially said it was my problem and I needed to find another seat.

I moved to the only vacant seat on the wall and it was some sort of broken, caved in seat that sat about a foot beneath the other seats. I also got to sit very close to a nice Asian man who was on his laptop beside me.

Oahu coffee is mentioned everywhere and they don't have any of it.

The blonde girl behind the counter was very nice and she's the only reason I didn't give this location 1 star.

I used the men's bathroom and it was totally disgusting. I mentioned it to her that it could use cleaning and she said ok, but didn't clean it.

I cleaned my new table with an alcohol wipe and it was black and disgusting, indicating the tables aren't cleaned well at all. Ick.

About an hour later, the girl made me move again! She said I could move back to my old seat, but someone was in it. I think it was pretty obvious that someone was in it, too. Apparently, she had to clean the other side of the room at this point in time.

They have nothing healthy in their glass display case. Everything is full of sugar, empty calories and carbs. No whole wheat, nothing high in protein and nothing even remotely healthy.
author: Jason G.

description: OK location, but what happened to the 24hr schedule?  OK, I haven't been to this location for awhile and looks like they recently renovated the place, again.  Lots of outlets for power-hungry users and make sure to bring a power-strip to share the wealth, yo.
author: Chi T.

description: Bring a jacket if you are coming here to study/read and are going to stay for a few hours, it gets pretty chilly. Lots of room for sitting, and only 24 hour coffee shop in the area is a plus
author: Simran K.

description:
Hi, 24 hours! 

I came here with a friend to study last night. The place was bigger than most Starbucks with a bunch of places to sit -- from couches to wooden chairs. The place seem to be packed around 12AM but people eventually leave and go home to their cozy beds. However, my friend and I stayed there like a trooper till the sun slowly rose.

I got a white chocolate mocha, which was just the way I liked it. However, I was not asked if I wanted whip cream or not. I'm not being picky, but eh. No big deal. Also, the music was a little too loud. You got people studying and napping here so can't we just... pipe the Nutcracker down just a little? 

ANYWAYS, I'd still come here again because it's 24 hours though. I am still a long way from graduating, sniffle.
author: Karry D.

description:
Nice space, and the coffee was served by nice people and tasted good.  But the ATT Wi-Fi has been a disaster the two recent times I was here.

I think we should be able to expect good Wi-Fi at significant Starbucks, but this place is failing on the Wi-Fi front.
author: Gregory D.

description:
What sets this Starbucks apart from others is it is open 24 hours and one of the bigger Starbucks in the city.
Drinks are consistent like most Starbucks so I accept them for what they are.
As for the space it is quite nice with plenty of outlets so if you are one of those people who dislike the occupy Starbucks types I would stay away during daytime.
Washrooms are kept clean generally even though this place sees quite a bit of traffic. 
Parking can be an issue as there quite a few businesses in the plaza. It becomes quite easy in the after hours when other businesses are closed. 
Crowd is usually a lot of med students putting in all nighter.
This became my go to spot to grab a good my java fix when going on a long trip in the wee hours of the morning. 
Staff is pleasant as well so what is there to complain. 
P.S. On a hot day this place does get quite warm so one is more inclined to stick to the icy drinks too cool down.
author: Elvis A.

description:
just got a "m'lady" from the cashier ^^

Still a great place to study, people-watch, and meet new people! I talked with an elderly man who shared with me about his time serving the army in Korea. I really like the environment and the people that come here.
author: Hana K.

description:
I needed a cup of coffee.  It was 11PM.  And the phone navigator sent me to the Starbucks on 19th...right before closing.  Ok.  Where is the more coffee at this time of night?

Starbucks in the Laurel Village center!  That's where!  

This 24 hour establishment is a ringer for late night coffeeshop needs.  Parking is obviously, very easy because it's the only place in the shopping center open at a late hour.  Validated parking is during the day, FYI.  Don't forget to get your validation stamp!  There's a back door on the lot that funnels you to the front counter and you don't have to walk all the way around in inclement weather.  (Not that it's that far of a walk.  It is on the corner after all.)

Because I usually feel like a pilgrim in an unholy land just out of my need for coffee and landing in a Starbucks, I never notice anything else other than just getting my coffee and getting out of these places.  However, my partner in crime pointed out this snazzy contraption behind the glass called a Clover coffee maker.  Upon further questioning, the barista tells us its a bit like an inverted french press.  (Apparently, been around a few years.  But really, it's a Stanford-engineered, vacuum, inverted, French press thingy.  $11k a unit.  But who's keeping score?)  I'll try anything other than that cigarette pack flavored swill percolating in the tank for who knows how long!  We got two of these Clover coffees, different flavors.

Watching them perform the elaborate operation to make a single cup was entertaining.  A whole lot of stirring, filtering, vacuuming, etcetera for a single cup.  If you're in a hurry, get your frappé-thing and just go. Turns out, this stuff isn't half bad.  Definitely a smoother, more flavored cup of java.  Not overly bitter.  Really changed my paradigm of Starbucks.  Later, a realization was made that the recommended flavor of one of the cups was the most expensive on the list!  Hey I don't care.  Good job barista!  Doin' your job makin' a sale!

Other store details:  
It's clean inside...blah blah blah.  Sell tons of coffee stuff.  I definitely don't like the fact that there's table campers almost everywhere here all the time, making it hard to get a seat or a comfy seat or sofa by a window.  It's a real turn off for me because that clearly means there's not a lot of rotation going on for folks that want to drink coffee and interact with other human beings.  People even fall asleep at tables!  It looks more like a university computer lab in here than a coffeeshop.  You just got to watch like a hawk and strike when you see a seat open up.

Without a doubt, it's got to be the safest place in town as many of the local law enforcement community stop in on a frequent basis.

Oh little Clover machine, how I miss you...
author: Marty S.

description: Great staff at this location -- the place is clean and the service is excellent. It's also open 24 hours. And that's a 5-star Starbucks
author: Alex A.

description: the only 24 hour starbucks in the city im a fan
author: Leigh G.

description:
Recently renovated, this particular Starbucks location is full of suits and strollers.  Upwardly mobile women in power suits and clicky heels zoom through here to pick up their double shot soy lattes, as Spanish-speaking nannies sit around commiserating with each other about watching someone else's blonde toddlers.  It's definitely a much different neighborhood experience than my usual haunt in the Sunset.

If you are looking to sit by yourself while reading a newspaper or using your laptop, this is a great location:  there are TONS of seats/banquettes set up specifically for this purpose.  And there's even an area of comfy brown leather couches for socializing over by the window.  

What makes this Starbucks location a little bit nicer than average?  Well, for one there's FREE PARKING in a generally-crowded parking lot behind the building.  And this location feels very ROOMY, well-laid-out.  It's clean, efficiently run by friendly staff, and there are no bums lounging around on the furniture spreading bed bugs.  But there is still one lovely detail that makes this Starbucks just a slight cut above most of the rest:

It's open 24 hours a day.

Yes, you read that correctly.  What could be more fabulous than dropping in here at 2 am for a nice, soothing, post-clubbing mocha, or studying all night here for an exam?  Or sitting around kibbutzing with friends until all hours after a nearby Italian dinner at Pasta Pomodoro?

If only ALL Starbucks were open 24 hours a day!!!!
author: Amy L.

description:
I had a low-fat chai tea latte today.  It was great.  A little too hot for my tastes, but hey.  I know there's nobody yelping to see what the big deal is with this whole new Starbucks thing, Just looking to vent a little.
*I dislike the holiday themed cups.  Makes me feel uncomfortable. IDK why.  Fine- I hate them.  Take them away please, ASAP-
author: c d.

description: Great, friendly staff who serve up all your Starbucks' favorites. The Laurel Village Starbucks location has all that you expect from the chain. The one issue keeping it from 5 stars is that with all the windows and the corner location it can often be quite warm inside the cafe. Like many SF businesses, I don't believe they have air conditioning, but when you're drinking hot toasty beverages it's nice to be in a slightly cooler temperature. Starbucks still has the best hot chocolate so it's worth bearing the heat!
author: Ben B.

description:
When a Starbucks location exists within any 2 mile radius of you, it seems hard to find anything noteworthy or unique to say about any one experience. What makes this Starbucks any different from every other one out there? A $12,000 piece of coffee machinery set to send any engineer or coffee geek into a tizzy. 

So in the window, there's this sign that promotes "Clover." Thinking it had something to do with tea, I ignored it for the most part. Then the barista asked if I'd like just a regular cup of the house blend OR (pointing in the direction of this exclusive looking contraption) "a Clover cup." Regardless of the cost, I had to know what the Clover thing entailed, so $2.95 later, I watched on as she pulled the 100% Kona beans out of a plastic container, measured them into a small tin, ground them up fresh to order, dropped them in the top of this Clover brewing system and watched as a stainless steel filter lowered my grind into the brew chamber. Hot water (at exactly 180 degrees) poured into my brew and not before long, I had a fresh cup of crazy good coffee.

I'm just as pretentious as the next Californian when it comes to individualized drip coffee, but Starbucks just took a sleek, geeked-out approach to what a place Blue Bottle does best: serving you freshly ground coffee at the peak of its flavor.
author: Monica S.

description: This place is pretty good for a starbucks in the city... free parking?!?! WHAT? Good amount of seats... but they could probably add a few more if they didn't have those displays in the center taking up all the room. Staff is friendly. Place gets pretty busy though. The only reason I took a star away is because the internet here sucks. Otherwise, a good study spot!
author: Johnson S.

description:
The service is really good. Friendly, quick and precise. Like any starbucks the staff cater to your every caffeine related need. The layout is great. They have couches, tons of tables and a decently large space. Only drawback would be at times it can be crowded so waiting for a seat can happen. The vibe overall is cozy. A ton of students and young people come here. Perfect for those in college for studying or social activity. 

I live in this place during finals. Speaking of finals, I have work to do!
author: Zack E.

description:
Given that everything in this damned town seems to close way too early, I really love the fact that this Starbuck's is open all night. This is the first Starbuck's I've heard of that's open 24 hours, and I love it!

My only complaint is that, for a 24 hour business, this place suffers from a real dearth of tweakers. Instead, we have yuppies and college students with MacBooks.

Last time I was here, the rich yuppie conversation I overheard made me feel kind of inadequate, 'cause it reminded me how much my own life is not on track. These yuppies? Even when their lives aren't on track, they're still doing better than me.
author: Max R.

description:
TWENTY FOUR - SEVEN!

If I can wake my happy ass out of bed in the morning, I come here before work and grab my usual breakfast sandwich and my grande coffee but there's also numerous times that I have come here with my fellow classmates and crammed before a big test. It's pretty quiet here; considering it's always packed but finding a table for a study group can be near impossible. 

Overall, cool Starbucks and feeds my caffeine addiction at any hour of the day!
author: Albert L.

description:
This Starbucks rocks! Study study study! or socialing with friends.  24hours, Key-Access clean restrooms, friendly staff and super easy parking.  Can't complain to any of that so this place is getting 5 stars.

Wow someone fell asleep and sounds like an underwater orchestra in here!
author: Victor V.

description:
This is my go-to Starbucks when I'm at/near school. 

Baristas are really nice for the most part. 

Lines can get super long quick. So hopefully you catch it when the line isn't too long. 

I feel like the tables get filled up quick. If you're trying to study, go early! 

There's metered parking in front of store AND a parking lot in back. 

Open 24hrs = MAJOR PLUS.
author: Jessica A.

description: Long lines for bad service and over priced coffee....what a surprise! This place is the worst Starbucks anywhere --- very badly managed.  Then people hanging out for hours on end so there is no place to sit!! If you want to pay a lot for coffee in a de facto study hall and homeless shelter combined ---this is the place for you....if you have some taste look elsewhere ,,,,,,,,I can't believe the number of good reviews here ---very suspicious if you know what I mean.....
author: Bill B.

description:
After this being my go-to place for a quick morning coffee and/or a desperate overnighter during exam week, I've decided to finally give it a review.

Starbucks isn't the best place for coffee; with that said, this place seems to be one of the better Starbucks in the city (this and the one on Montgomery between Sutter and Post). They are usually spot-on with espresso varieties (specifically, the male baristas); I don't recall having a drink that was meant for someone with and uber-sweet tooth. If you're someone that likes the exorbitant amounts of flavoring, then the Fillmore location will do you just right. This place also has the clover-brewing system. I don't claim to have fine-tuned palette for coffee so I'm not exactly sure if it lives up to the hype, but the machine is sleek and shiny so it must be awesome right?

An added bonus is that it's open for 24hrs minus the 3 hours on Mondays 1am-4am, I believe. This place usually filled with students and cops (I like to think of this place as a police station that serves coffee) Like other reviews have said, it's extremely difficult to find a seat at certain times, but there is usually something open. The way to get the "perfect seat" is to just take what you can get, then upgrade as the day/night goes on(I guess this could be said about a lot of things in life haha). Figure out the best times to come yourself...

The lines seems to be at its worst right when the high schoolers come, which is could take about 8-10min to receive your order; other than that, the wait time seems to be on par with other busy coffeeshops.

All things considered, this place is better than the average Starbucks.
author: Carmelo D.

description: Went here to study last night. Do you know how hard it is to find a good place to study late at night, around UCSF? DO YOU?? so the only other place I try is tart 2 tart... but its crowded and dingy and they close at 2... This is the next closest thing. I'm giving it four stars because its the only thing open in the middle of the night where I can get coffee and snacks... its ALWAYS packed... especially on a friday or saturday night. The chairs are comfortable and its relatively clean. Just come here.. dont waste your time looking for a place to study because, there have been many-a-time where I have... and failed. lol
author: Mish L.

description:
It is my favorite spot / sbux to chill and study. Baristas do remember you well and really good at making orders. Plus, they are super nice. 

It is a very nice place to study and have coffee together at late night. 

One thing its bad is that now everyone know about this place so this place gets really crowded.

Also,- FYI- this place closes at 1am on SUNDAYS. It is 24 hrs for Mon-Sat. 

There are some ppl who tries to sleep in at this place - NOT allowed- time to time but it is really rare... Cops come to this place all the time - which I really like - makes this place safe. Seats are very comfortable and Restrooms are 90% clean.
author: Rachel H.

description: I love this starbuck. It's open 24hr because there are lots of businesses in the area and of course a hospital. There are an endless flow of people coming in and out of this place. Regular and new customers alike. They have a large area where patronages are able to sit and socialize. The staff here are awesome! Super friendly and always gets your order right to taste.
author: Sol P.

description: Meh.  It's a Starbucks - but they don't let customers prop the doors open no matter how hot it gets, and they don't have air conditioning.  Whhaaaat?  When I asked why we couldn't open the doors, the girl at the counter said it was a health regulation.  Hah. Not.
author: F C.

description: the workers are super friendly! great customer service!
author: Victoria T.

description: Gr8 location close to where I live but it's overly crowded all the time! Open 24 hrs which is a plus
author: Anthony S.

description:
I would say this is a pretty standard Starbucks. I like the drinks so I keep coming back. If you think the coffee tastes bad, its not the place for you.

Occasionally service is REALLY slow. but 95% of the time im in and out within 5 minutes. 
 
Most Starbucks only deserve 4 stars but this one gets a 5th for being open 24hours. :)
author: Laura F.

description: This place is always crackin' no matter what time of day. The baristas are always so happy! I'd say that maybe they need to calm down on the coffee, but it probably helps them get through their work shift. Clean bathrooms. The girl that makes the drinks in the middle of the night, I think her name is Krystle, is pretty cool too. She knows how to make a drink!
author: Denise H.

description:
I suppose the people giving this location five stars are the ones who show up with their laptops and park themselves in a seat for hours on end.  

I love a good pumpkin spice latte on a fall day, but I also love to be able to sit for, say, five minutes to enjoy it.  No such luck at this location, which sadly, is my neighborhood Starbucks.  It is ALWAYS completely overrun by folks who like to treat it as their personal office/living room.  Half the time, they don't even appear to be drinking a beverage at all, just enjoying the free wifi while perusing their email or facebook.  

I must say I blame Starbucks for the problem.  FIrst, they redesigned the location to attract this crowd - the seating here caters to computer users - lots of countertop space.  Secondly, the employees turn a blind eye to the shameless loitering.  The last time I stopped in, there was a chick chilling on one of the few comfy chairs with her textbook, seriously pretending we were all at her house.  Her shoes and socks were in a pile in front of her and she was rubbing her bare feet all over the chair while occasionally looking up to glare at patrons who were searching for a seat.  And she, like the guy next to her who was doodling endlessly on a sketch pad, had no beverage in sight.  Not even an empty one.  I did see a thermos with some soup though.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
My favorite Starbucks in SF because I'm a student and there nowhere else that is open 24 hours serving me coffee every few hours as I study. The downside of this place is.... it's ALWAYS crowded with students like myself, so I now only come here to grab a drink in the middle of the night before I head off to go study somewhere else.

3.5 overall for the hours/free wifi/PARKING/friendly staff :)

To me it's like any other starbucks minus the 24/7 service.
author: Tina T.

description:
You and I were great friends during the final days of my graduate studies. We spent many evenings and early mornings together. You even kept my spirits up with countless shots of espresso amidst the breezy brink of dawn San Francisco air.

You are always accessible, 24 hours a day, and I can park anywhere nearby on the street. Free internet is a major plus.

I wish you had more space for me when I come visit you, but no one is perfect. Your worker bees are friendly, personable, and put a smile to my face.

There should be more of your kind in San Francisco because all we need is love. :)
author: Tina C.

description:
I work right across the street. So why have I chosen NOT to go here?

1. Strollers ALL OVER THE PLACE. You can't walk, sit, drink, eat, or talk without a stroller bumping into you, or some baby crying. Just because you have a stroller, doesnt mean you are queen of the god damn world and that we have to move over or act as if you were handicapped. Stop hitting me with your stroller. 
2. Theres ALWAYS  line, either 6 strollers are in front of me taking up space or its just constantly busy here (even at 330 in the afternoon).

Why is it so hard just to get a cup of coffee?
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Friends don't let friends drink Starbucks.

But when it's 4am and you've got to pee real bad and there's nowhere else for you to go - Starfucks is here for ya. 

1 star for being 24 hours.
another star for being a good spot to people watch aka gawk at Yuppies and make fun of them.
author: Susy C.

description:
Its open 24 HOURS??? Came here with my bud Rico on the way to a site.. Man they know how to get you your stuff and get you back on the road. With a smile!! Its good for workers that need to get back to work fast. 

 Will come  back next time I pull a bad shift lol!!
author: Xavior G.

description:
When I need to get S--t done this is where I go.  Why? Its the only 24 hour Starbucks in SF!  Its conveniently located on the #1 bus line which is a plus for me.  Also since there are so many people studying here you def. feel the pressure to soldier on. 

Here are a few tips to maximize your study experience:
1.  If you come here after 5 PM it will be really hard to find a spot.  Let alone two.  Please plan accordingly and pray to God if you want to get a seat next to an outlet. 
2.  Prior to work this place will be jam packed w/ Laurel Heights moms that are dropping their kids off at the JCC, organizing play dates and mommies that cafffeinate suport groups. 
3. Take only what you need.  I'll be honest you aren't gonna get alot of real estate on the table so if you plan on spreading your crap out: 5 different high lighters, a rainbow of post it flags, iPod, iPhone and laptop....please don't come here.  
4. If you suffer from caffeine overload, you can take the UCSF shuttle to Parnassus from a block away or one of the aspiring med students can practice on you....
author: Sarah C.

description:
Can we get a Y -A-Y!!! for 24 hour Starbucks'. I think that was the best decision that the company has ever made.
This place is always busy.. even at wee hours.
Coffee is always good, and there are almost, always seats available to sit in.
author: Tiff C.

description:
I am not a fan of Starbucks coffee. I don't like the sugary sweet coffee drinks that have too much milk and syrup. And the drip coffee is just too bitter.

But, this Starbucks has this Clover Press thingy so I can get person cups of coffee. I've order the Kona coffee the last few times and it tastes great with just a dash of half and half. 

Also there is a lot of seating and ever since I discovered I can get free-wi-fi when I load up a Starbucks Card, this has become my new "search-for-a-job-online" cafe.
author: Julia H.

description: Dat free internet tho I wrote some gay porn stories in here people Jizz all over the coffee the coffee tastes sticky with a hint of cum in my face
author: Ewok T.

description:
24 hours is worth 5 stars already.

Venti iced skinny caramel macchiato is what gets me through my 4 hour night classes
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I'll do the cons before pros to justify my 4 stars.

CONS:

-pretty gross bathrooms (even though you need a password, its gross)
-weird crowded hallway type thing where strangers are sitting side by side, some starring as you enter from the back entrance or head over to the bathroom
-windows fog up like crazy with all the human bodies inside during finals week
-also impossible to sit anywhere but by the edge of a window (not a real seat)

PROS:

-it was actually fun to sit by the edge of a window while charging my phone and chatting it up with friends
-I liked the fact that it was packed with college students during finals week at 1am
-it's open 24 hours, and that's a dream come true for me
-even though the back parking lot seems a little tiny bit sketchy to me, I'm glad they have more than just street parking
author: Elaine H.

description: Friendly staff! My favorite of all the Starbucks I go to. They're also open 24 hours a day which makes it convenient for a coffee fix.
author: Sherman B.

description: I live near this Starbucks and used to stop in every morning but the service has gotten so slow here that I just head to work and stop at the Fillmore Starbucks. I like the new re-model - more seating and fewer students camped out for hours on end but I wish they could get better workers here so they could move the lines.
author: Ann W.

description:
Betty W. and I have spent MANY nights here while we drowned in coffee, books on law and teeth, and what seems to be a never ending line of customers. By the time i was done with my boards and she was done with law school finals, this starbucks felt like home --- and yes, we are a little bit lame. 

Why 5 stars for a regular chain starbucks?
- its open 24 hours 
- it has clover blend coffee!
- the workers are nice (and one of them looks like chris brown =x) 
- it is very large with lots of space to study
- parking is plentiful 
- lots of interesting people to stare at ^^;;
_________
things that will only make sense to betty w :
- muffin top 
- big red
- the adventures of finding the perfect seat

It can be very hard to find seats here as a lot of the time it is full of students from usf, pacific dent, etc
author: Tim B.

description:
As I write this, it is 5:20AM. I have been here since 8pm, working on an all-nighter for a class. This place is a life saver, but I question if its a life worth saving. Haha, just kidding. Without sleep I'm as bitter as coffee without cream. There have been just enough weirdos to keep things interesting, but not so many that I risk crawling back home, where my warm bed awaits.

Oh yeah, the coffee. Its good. I had a (or three) cup(s) of regular coffee cause I'm cheap and here for-freakin'-ever.

Thank you, Starbucks. "Good" morning.
author: Matt B.

description: It's a Starbucks, kids. So, yeah. It's a Starbucks. This one has the new "Clover" machine which is supposed to be fairly high tech on the grind and the brew. A mere thousand or so Starbucks have this particular machine, so that is supposed to mean it's an "Oo, Ah" moment. Um, it was good coffee, but I can't say my skirt got blown up in the air by the taste or anything. The staff here is friendly, so that was a bonus. All in all, it's a Starbucks, and, hey, it got my caffeine level back up to normal range again. Yay! Downside: absolutely no room to sit down and get any writing done. The place was packed. Boo.
author: Shadi G.

description:
Ah yes, MY Starbucks in the city.  Yes MINE.  I spent more time here than at home the past couple of months trying to study for an evil (no joke) exam.  True to its claim, the location is 24 hours (closes for a few hours Sunday night/Monday morning).

Parking is plentiful during most times of the day- seats are not.  This place is BUSY (I heard it's the busiest SB in town).  That includes weekends, weekdays, weeknights- I've had my share of coffee at all times of the week and I can tell you people flow through this place consistently.  

If you want to grab a seat to get some reading done, I suggest getting here before 7pm for a good shot, otherwise just hope for good luck.  The staff is also really nice and if you're nice to them, they'll be nice to you too (like how that works?).  Great place to get some studying done at night.
author: Daniel L.

description:
For all those late nights working on papers, studying for finals, and coming here for the free wifi while sipping on my green tea or chai tea latte, I thank you, 24 hour Starbucks. This is the only place where I can sit down and crank out a paper, get distracted by people watching, see the cops come by at 2 in the morning for their usual round of coffee.

I love this place. The workers are nice despite working at the late night hours, it's always clean, your drink orders are usually on time, but around the major study days you'll be hard pressed to find an outlet to plug your laptop in if you need it. It's packed and all the prime study space is usually occupied from 9PM-1AM. So if you come in before or after those times, you can manage to find a seat easily.
author: Leslie K.

description: Review is only for the coffee, the people here are awesome, the cappuccino I got was so gross haven't had Starbucks in awhile but wow tasted like a shot of espresso not a Cappuccino.  also tasted like burnt coffee, who knows maybe Starbucks coffee got worse.  Again people here are fine, place is clean and friendly but please work on your coffee skills, or let Corporate know they have sent you ruined coffee beans
author: Nirea S.

description: Though I do not go to coffeehouses, really, at least do not spend much time in them despite the convenience and easy sociability of the people in these places, especially in S.F., this is an 'industrial strenght' Starbucks coffee place that must have clientele at all hours.  The area this place is in has one doing double - takes on some things that might also be in the Haight, though I hope and know I am completely wrong here.  A really nice place to get a cup of coffee, meet friends, josh around and so forth, ..., and from the looks of things here it's not totally for kids nor for the super - young crowd that one finds in such places sometimes.  Nice!
author: Thomas H S.

description:
Hands down the greatest Starbucks in the world. There are many interesting people that are fun to talk to late night, and there are lots of spacious couches and places to work. Staff is awesome!

You may have to wait a bit to find a spot. It's nice because even though you'd imagine a 24 hour anything to be super sketchy, most of the people mind their own business and there are police who come in and out all night, so it's safe.
author: Hannah J.

description:
Everyone has to review at least one Starbucks in their lifetime. And if there is any worth reviewing it's this one. Having been a student at USF I loved this place. There is parking like in the burbs and sexy med students. Good mix. 

We all know that Starbucks isn't the best coffee and their hot chocolate bites, but they have good tea. Hard to get that wrong.
author: Lee M.

description: Place was a mess at 8:30 pm when it was slow.  Garbage full, condiment table filthy, and all sorts of stuff on the floor.  You'd think they could at least keep things tidy for the prices we pay!!  They had 3 baristas on duty so I'm not sure why they didn't have time to service the place.
author: Mark L.

description: Busiest-but quickest- Starbucks I've ever seen! These guys know how to make drinks quick! This location is always packed with students studying, joggers, families, and even police officers. Even under all the pressure, the staff are somehow still super friendly and always manage to brighten up my day! They also have a really good selection of things to buy in their store, which is awesome! My favorite barista here is Mark. No matter how complicated of a drink I request, it's made perfectly! I never forget some tip money for these hard workers!
author: Brittany F.

description: Love coming to this spot since it's open 24/7. Having that said, it helps me fulfill my random cravings at 2am. My favorite drinks to get so far are.. White Chocolate Mocha HOT/COLD. Sometimes with a pump of Hazelnut. Passion Fruit Lemonade. Pumpkin Spice Latte. Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate. Caramel Brulee Latte. Hot/Cold. Occasionally would buy some Madelines as well hehe :)
author: cadence p.

description: 5 stars for being the only 24 hour starbucks around! +1 more star for good customer service whether it be in the busy morning or graveyard shift at night.
author: Calvin T.

description:
Hard to give anything less than 5 stars when they appear to be the only coffee shop in town open 24 hours with easy parking and wifi... at least this is basically the only place that popped up in my yelp and google search. 

Jetlag sucks but is made bearable when I can get a cup of coffee and a muffin at 3 in the morning :)
author: John B.

description:
No complaints really. wait a minute, except that a cup of coffee can cost me up to $5 [but that's standard if youre going to buy coffee anywhere nowadays].. and o except that sometimes i cannot find a seat or that people put their bags on other seats so that there isnt room for me : (

i love getting a drink just so i can sit down by the window and watch the cars go by. i feel like a kid again. haha!

free wifi is a plus
author: Veranna N.

description: Great place to study. Opened 24 hours. Music is quiet and easy to phase out. At times the place gets loud, just remember to bring headphones or ear plugs.
author: Tiffany H.

description: This Starbucks is great for studying, although there is always pretty fierce competition for tables and chairs during peak times. Once you have a spot, though, it's an awesome spot to camp out for a few hours an chug through some homework and espresso.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Oohhh!! My friend pointed out that they are the only starbucks in the area with the special brewing system. I tried out the clover brewer, single cup style and it was pretty good! Wow! I was surprised! Then again, I'm not that huge a coffee coniesuer so maybe I don't have the authority to make that judgement but I know what I like, and I liked it! 
I usually go for a medium blend where it's not too darkly roasted but just enough so that it's acceptable. The 100% kona was good!
author: Tu L.

description: Too heavy on the mocha in the peppermint mocha. BUT the lattes are good. The staff is super friendly! Best interior decor in San Francisco... to me.
author: Stacy C.

description:
I hate. hate. hate. Starbucks. Why go here when there are SO many independent coffee shops that not only have better (read: real) coffee, but have generally healthier options and also help the community?

Now that I've hopped off my mini soapbox, I will credit this ONE Starbucks with being open 24 hours, because it helped me through a really rough final exam cram session. And the staff was friendly enough.
author: Sam S.

description:
Good-sized Starbucks.

I like their tables.

This used to be a hardware store (i think).

I wasn't aware of their 24hour open-status...thanks yelpers.
author: Derek N.

description: I must say, this Starbucks is one of the fastest I've been to in the city. The busier they are, the faster they move!
author: Lisa R.

description:
I love Starbucks because there is one at every corner you turn...convience

This is my favorite one..  Open 24/7 and ample parking!

minus 1 star for being so crowded.

*Note* Just because you buy 1 cup of whatever doesn't entitle you hog a table for 4 hours......
author: Angelica C.

description: It's the only place that's opened 24 hours! Good luck trying to find a place to sit, the place can get packed. Sunday nights they close at 1:00 AM for cleaning. The only down fall it's hard to find a seat when you come around 5pm.
author: SF S.

description: The best part of this Starbuck is that its open 24 hours. The worst part is that there are sometimes long lines just to order drinks and its so hard to find a place to sit. It seems like every time i get there, there are no sits available since everyone goes here to study.
author: Ash R.

description:
SERVICE:
24 hr! What! Unlimited free wifi!

ATMOSPHERE:
But downside is it's packed :((((((
author: Angela L.

description: For the space I give them a 4 for the coffee I give them a 3. Nice spacious and clean with lots of electrical plugs and WiFi
author: Karen T.

description:
JAVA CHIP FRAPPUCCINO!!!!! ADDICTED (O_X)  $3.59 (GRANDE) for yummy goodness!  for some reason or another i need caffeine at nite time. Yea I noe imma weird XD


closest starbucks that i noe is open 24hrs!!! Need I say more!

oh wait I will, The first nite that I met Marie we came here for hrs of chit chat and got to know each other even more. :)  yadayadayda We have been together ever since :D

NOTE: chill spot for a lot of college students and people that jest loved being wired on coffee at nite into the wee morning hrs XD
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Same drinks and food you'll find at any Starbucks.  And food is stocked throughout the night.  They restocked at about 9:30pm when I was there the other day.  Another plus, the baristas are always friendly and serve with a smile, plus they are super skilled at dealing with a long line.  

Reasons two stars were deducted:
1. Not enough electrical outlets for laptops, so I'm limited to 4 hours or switching my seat.
2. Need MORE SEATING, this place is always crowded!

But, it is open 24 hours, 7 days a week.  When I'm in need of a place to do work in the middle of the night, or even late-ish at night, this is my go-to place.  Might have to get friendly with some other people, but it's never been too bad.  It's definitely more of a working crowd than a place to chit chat, at least during the evenings.  During the day, I've seen lots of strollers and work-from-home people.  And of course students.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
One of the worst Starbucks you can go to.  The line is always super long and when it isn't, you have to battle for space because every patron comes in with a baby stroller at least two deep.

I work nearby so the only time I make it over here is in the morning or during lunch.  Forget it, I only get a hour and I don't want to waste my time in line.

The staff is nice.  I think they know there's a stroller/mom/nanny problem and they try to accommodate the people who just work in the neighborhood and not produce in it.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
Probably the best Starbucks in the city in my opinion. The place is pretty big compared to other Starbucks in the city. The great thing about this location though is that it is the only 24/7 place in the entire city. 

The coffee is pretty good (typical starbucks) and the staff is very friendly also.

One thing to keep in mind though. Despite the place being generous in size it is usually full at night with students from neighboring schools.
author: Ajay K.

description: Decided to give this Starbucks another chance today and boy did they change! Looks like they hired a lot of new people. The staff was super friendly and quick, which was much appreciated. Also, they finally made my drink correctly! Super happy about the improvements. I will definitely be back!
author: Brooke T.

description: As a grad student, I really appreciate this 24-hour Starbucks, and consider myself a regular.  The baristas are so friendly, and although it gets crowded here, it's a pretty comfortable place to write, study or just hang out.
author: Bridget B.

description:
Why give it 4 stars while there's another Starbucks right across the street? It's the magic clover machine!

Through my "continuing education" from someone I admire dearly, I know there's at least a couple around downtown... searching on iPhone I found this!

The Panama La Florentina was crazy strong and good, and I was recommended to try the iced version. I always love a strong cup of cold coffee.

This cup would last me the whole day!! But I must also add that the beans were still far from the great ones over at Ritual that I tried last weekend (see my review on 6/2)...

I wish Starbucks did not play monopoly so that more places would have the machine. Having a good cup of coffee is not about waking up on a tired morning or keep up a busy day, it's about enjoying the blossoming the beans, demystifying a stressful workday into relishing the lively life in this gorgeous weather, savouring the birth of delight. Having the machine available at smaller venues would have been like sharing the joy and happiness with others. sigh...
author: T L.

description: Very busy and the lines are too long. Very friendly staff and consistently good coffee.
author: yan k.

description: This is a very very crowded location. However, they are very efficient and your coffee order will come out very quickly. People lounge around, so seats are hard to find. Overall, I like this place. One other gripe, is that coffee strength is a bit inconsistent here sometimes. I ordered the same thing every time, but once in awhile it'll taste very differently.
author: Anatoly B.

description: 5 Stars because a 24 hour Starbucks (when they're not shoveling you to the other side of the room during their 2 am clean-up schedule) is a scarce resource.  5 Stars because I can always manage to get work done when I drive all the way over here - and I can pick up some Krispy Kreme at the Cal Mart next door.  It also helps that there's no weirdos and the staff is always upbeat and friendly.  Parking's not too difficult - depending on what time of the day you enter the back parking lot - but you eventually find a spot - and its validated!
author: Nin J.

description: This place is great!  It's open 24 hours and has a very nice staff.  The area is pretty quiet and easy to get to (Laurel Heights).  At 2am, you would never believe how crowded it gets.  Definitely a great place to go online while having a great cup of java.
author: Anita H.

description:
Ever since I heard about this place, I haven't been able to stay away from it. My ochem grade has actually improved (but my sleep cycle is all screwed up) because the one thing I look forward to on a blah day is driving down the empty, dark streets in the middle of the night to Starbucks, getting comfy with my cup of coffee (cheap refills!) and books, and working on chemistry problems. So is my life. And what's nice is that everyone else there is busy with something too, so there's not a lot of gabbing.

I was surprised at how crowded it is at 12am, and there's not a lot of tables and chairs. Sometimes I have to sit in my car and wait for a table to open up. Also, police officers frequently drop in for a cup of coffee and a chat. I don't know if that makes me feel safe or worried. . .

Oh, Starbucks, even though I'm against chain cafes with mediocre coffee, you have saved my life!
author: Kym M.

description:
I've been coming here almost everyday for the past two months as I'm in the middle of studying-so-I-can-get-into-grad school extravaganza.  

It's usually pretty clean, especially for the huge amount of traffic that comes in here at night, being the only thing open other than that Donut store on Clement in this area.  Probably the most comfortable Starbucks I've been to for studying- well lit, sensible amount and placement of furniture.

This Starbucks also seems to play better music, some classics from Fresh Prince, Tribe Called Quest, and Queen Latifah came on tonight when I was studying.  Way better than the usual coffee shop elevator music.  

Writing mostly to complement the night staff.  They're super friendly and funny despite how cold it gets, the crazy people who come in the cops don't do anything about, or if the store gets egged at 1am.  Super nice and welcoming and quick with orders.
author: Bessie C.

description: Everyone knows this location is open 24-hours, always super poppin' with plenty of sweaty butt-cracks, blah blah blah. Unbeknownst to me, it's apparently a great stop for wedding parties too. Yeah! I bet you didn't know that! Last night I saw a ridiculously decked-out bride and groom with their pastel and chiffon adorned bridesmades and wedding guests gathered outside the store like a class of kids on a field trip. Starbucks cups in hand, there was some schmoozing here, mingling there...it was clearly a stingy wedding reception of some sort. Classy!
author: Suany W.

description:
Here is a continuation of my Study-In-The-City reviews of cafes:

Positives:
1) Open 24-7 and fairly clean
2) Most seats are well lit
3) Almost every seat has its own plug
4) Free internet (if you pay via a starbucks card, which is not a c.c.; transfer $ into the card whenever its empty and use 1x per month)
5) comfy seats line both walls (matters if you need some cushion);
6) more food selection than other starbucks and access to food at a few nearby places
7) staff is generally nice and doesn't bug you (even for bringing outside food)
8) individual "clover" coffee (strong for studying)

Negatives:
1) 1 of the baristas thinks that loud fake friendliness (to anyone who will speak with her) is a virtue;
2) lonely old people who pop up next to you to either yell at you or befriend you cuz they have no one to talk to (when the barista in #1 isn't working);
3) crowdedness (usually evening/night and weekends)
4) DAY TIME parking (LOT:  90 minutes in their lot with a guy writing tickets every 2 hrs; STREET:  nil cuz located near a hospital and school)
author: Caitlyn K.

description:
So I am a regular customer here, I actually come here quite often but now, I may not be. I have put off writing this for some time now hoping it would get fixed. I am frustrated with easy fixes that should be addressed. First, the new re model is great but where did all the power outlets go? There should be more for the chair section in the front, because if the tables are taken, where is one supposed to plug in? And the new supposed "google wifi" is even worse. The speed is even slower, making any work to be done, impossible. Whats ironic is the "Trouble Connecting?" link on the splash page is pointless because in order for it to show fixes, you have to be connected..... doesn't really seem to make sense does it? The internet for a late night cafe is crucial, on the same level of importance as the actual coffee is. Please, get a T1 speed connection or at least upgrade the router so multiple people can be on the web at the same time! This is the 21st century, my 3G blackberry is faster than this wifi crap!

As well as, you spend $3-4 on a refresher and get a FULL cup of ice with a teaspoon of the actual drink. at least make it part of the $0.50 refill. Not to mention names but its the new young kid with the super short blonde hair, who also never smiles or is friendly at all. When hes making drinks, its a cup of ice for $4. And the other drinks made by him, never taste good, i dont know if he wasn't properly trained on how to make drinks or if he's just lazy but PLEASE, starbucks, show him how to make drinks properly!! Light ice should mean......light ice!!

One other thing, where does the line start? There are always two lines starting in front of the registers, making it very confusing and mis leading. Please make a damn sign or at least make it clear where to line up.
author: Jossy W.

description: They have quick service and friendly staff. There are lots of space to relax and enjoy a cup of coffee. There are alot of people coming in and out so that's good. means that they're doing really well. But sometimes the customers just sit there way to long, just hogging up the space. But it's close to my home and 24hrs so i can get a cup of coffee when ever I want.
author: Peter L.

description:
What's better than Starbucks? Starbucks that is open 24 hours a day. That sentence by itself says it all. Five stars for that shit alone. 

I love my Starbucks. Everyone knows that already. No big surprise there. 

It takes a lot for me to give a bad review of my caffeine wielding monopoly coffee shop, but this one is better, because I can stay caffeinated 24/7.

I don't sleep much, and when I do, I usually sleep like crap, so there are many times I just want to get out of bed and drive or write, instead of staring at the ceiling. This Starbucks has given me wondrous amounts of support to my unhealthy insomniac habit. I can get up and drive for only ten to fifteen minutes and be there in Laurel Heights at Starbucks at 2 am. I know this sounds ridiculous, but there's nothing better than being able to get out and go somewhere when you can't sleep.

Hey, can you blame me? I like to be productive.

Plus it's a great escape from Marin. Yes, you assumed correctly. I drive from Marin into SF for 24 hour Starbucks. It's sick, but it's beautiful. I'll even drive out to the beach afterwards and watch the sun come up. It's like being sixteen again, but without all the awkwardness.
author: Danielle S.

description: I usually have pleasant experiences @ this starbucks but this last visit was jus horrible!  Ordered the "clover coffee" and when I didn't know which type I wanted I was treated with disrespect as if I was stupid.  I wanted to complain but the person that mistreated me was the manager, "Tina''  How can this location have this "manager" running this place?
author: Mike K.

description:
Why you deserve my first five stars review: (Based solely on late night visits)

-24hrs of caffeine satisfaction 
-Double Chocolate Brownie things and Peppermint Hot Chocolates
-A comfy study area
-Many cops frequent this 'Bux late night which means I feel safe whilst sipping on my Quad Venti Iced Hazelnut Whole Milk Latte (Whew!)
-Last nights bathroom code was amusing. 90210, haha, silly baristas. (Well, I chuckled)
-Well-maintained bathrooms, maybe, because I only come here at ungodly hours. *shrugs

I love you Starbucks, but please stop building new ones on every corner of San Francisco.
author: Maggie H.

description: There's people living here at this coffee shop. Showering in the bathroom, eating dinner here and sleeping on couches with their luggage
author: M L.

description:
This review is for Keith who works at Starbucks on 3595 California street in Laurel Village. 

After getting to know Keith, I asked him if it's okay that I write a review for him on YELP. His immediate response was you don't have to. Thanks. But I insisted because it is an honor for me to write this review for Keith. 

This is why:

1) Keith's presence makes Starbucks in Laurel Village a unique coffee drinking experience. He greets you with his charming smile and kind eyes making you feel you've come over to his house for coffee! I used to think Keith was the owner of that Starbucks exactly because of his warm hospitality.

2) A friend of mine once said the experience of drinking coffee mainly comes from your company not the quality of the coffee. That is why I highly recommend Keith to open up his own coffee business. Even if Keith sells coffee grown in his backyard, I am sure he will be successful, knowing the way he makes people feel loved and welcomed.

3) From my observations of Keith's interactions with young, old, hurried, loud, ill, disabled, anxious, funny, talkative, quiet, man, woman, gay, straight, rich, poor, tall, short etc. customers at Starbucks, I can attest to the many roles Keith has played for folks, as well as a barista. His roles include a social worker, counselor, coach, lover!, listener, nurse, nap police, comedian, an interested audience when no one else is watching, and a childhood friend.

4) I wouldn't be surprised that the reason the laurel Heights Starbucks is packed even at odd hours like 3 am is because of Keith's reputation. Other coffee shops including other Starbucks in the neighborhood must have experienced the disappearance of their patrons as soon as Keith started his shift at the Laurel Heights Starbucks.
author: Joy J.

description:
