Many of you know that I'm a Peet's coffee fan.  Well, I don't know HOW my coworkers and other friends don't know this -- or maybe they know that there is no Peet's close to my office.  At any rate, I received a lot of Starbucks gift cards for Christmas.  So, this Sunday, after playing in the city, my family stopped in Laurel Village.  I got my coffee at Peet's and then we strolled down the long block (with stops at the Gymboree, bookstore, and 5 and dime along the way) to get kids' drinks for my little ones.  

I have to admit that as much as I love Peet's, drinks for kids' are limited there:  milk, hot coco, orange juice.  That's it!  At Starbucks, there are several options: several fizzy drinks and juices (in addition to what Peet's carries).

This particular Starbucks is a gorgeous space, with glass tiles behind the counter and a comfy, yet upscale living room feel to the space.  In addition, it was well-staffed so the line moved very briskly -- two baristas, two ringers, and one floater who took the order before we paid.  

So I don't mind stopping by for drinks for my kids as long as I get my Peet's fix first.
author: Patty W.

description: As a recent nursing school graduate this place has been the best to study in during those late hours. In the city your options for 24 hour cafes are limited, but this area is safe enough to leave at 4 am and not worry about your car that has parked in the back for the past 6 hours. The coffee and food is like any other starbucks but the location and hours are great for any night owl.
author: Brittany T.

description:
I'm writing to complain about an experience at this Starbucks late one evening  around 12:30 a.m. There was nowhere to sit when I arrived. The store was filled with mostly students who were studying for exams. Some students had moved furniture so they could sit side by side which was strange to see walking in. I should have just left when I realized it was that time of year since it is always like that around exams at this particular location. But, I ordered a coffee and a pastry and found a makeshift seating arrangement that was probably abandoned by some other student that had placed a regular seating chair at the end of the bar like area in the store. Moments later someone left a regular table so I prepared to move, but as I was sitting down I saw a disabled couple who also wanted to sit there and I just let them take the table because I thought that was the right thing to do. 

Meanwhile, this other chair in the front of the store was available so I sat there instead. Wow, I wish I did not do that! Sitting directly across from me was a homeless looking person who was sound asleep with no beverage or anything in sight. And I was already irritated because of all the students leaching off and slowing the wifi connection, some of whom also did not buy anything. But it wasn't until I saw the person seated next to me inhale a white substance that I thought was cocaine that I asked to talk to the Manager on Duty. While I was waiting for the Manager, who was not on the sales floor for whatever reason, the associate I talked to saw this person inhaling whatever it was that they were inhaling. The Manager appeared a few minutes later and apologized, said he would call the police, and offered nothing else. I reiterated that I was not satisfied and at my urging he gave me coupon, or gift card, or something for a free drink. I was fine with that at the moment but was pretty surprised by what happened next. The police came and escorted the drug user or person who was inhaling something out of the store. And at the same time, I should mention that the other two homeless people seated in the same area were still sound-asleep. I thought to myself well, at least I did something and I felt fine. 

BUT THEN- the other homeless looking person who was escorted out by the police returns to the store! AND- it gets even better, the Manager then apologizes to him and offers him a free drink or refill??!  I was dumbfounded and frankly, shocked that this is how it was being handled. But then again, I seemed to be the only person bothered by it. I decided to just leave since I did not feel comfortable and talked to the Manager again before I left because I didn't want to seem like the bad person involved. There was no line but at one point someone else appeared and I casually said something like "wouldn't you be weirded out if someone sitting next to you snorts a white substance that looks like cocaine?" in their direction. That other person obviously had no idea what I was talking about and said nothing and then the Manager acted as if I was being confrontational. Maybe I was, I don't think so, but I probably should not have even involved some other random person. Regardless, I've experienced many weird situations living in San Francisco as long as I have, but this has got to be the weirdest I have ever experienced inside a Starbucks! 

I sympathize for the homeless people in the store but they should not be allowed to just occupy space inside a Starbucks without buying anything and likewise, using drugs or inhaling substances should not be allowed in any store, Starbucks or not. The Manager was friendly and said he could do nothing beyond what he already did which I believe is mostly true. I think apologizing and offering a free refill to a homeless person who is inhaling substances, cocaine or not is a little strange but I get it that his actions were limited. The store doesn't have security and after all, I appeared to be the only person bothered by this anyway. Most everyone else was oblivious and plugged into whatever device they were using. Surprisingly the most observant people in the store were the disabled couple I mentioned. They appeared to be hearing impaired as they were communicating using American Sign Language. I only know a few words in ASL but could definitely understand the shrug and eye roll that we exchanged as I was leaving.

I don't know what the answer is or what Starbucks can do about this, but something needs to be done and I know for certain that what happened that evening is not the right thing.
author: L. A.

description:
I finally find a good spot to hand out with my friends. 
I like this starbuck. Cause good costumers service, nice peoples 
clean. and the most open 24hrs. 

If there i wanna to go out at nite to hand out. use to be I 
will go the bar hand out the park. now this is my spot..
author: sean c.

description:
I frequent here on random nights of the week, generally anywhere from midnight to 5 a.m. because, as a night owl, there's only so many things to do in the Richmond District besides eat at Jack in the Box or Video Cafe.  

They are open 24 hours unless if you happen to be there on Sunday night (early Monday morning) at 1:00 a.m. when they close up shop for about three hours.  Being one of the larger Starbucks, you would think that there would be open seats, but the place is always packed.  It's safe to say that if you grew up in the city, you're bound to run into someone you know on any night of the week.

The drinks are okay, just what you would expect from a large coffee chain, mediocre crack at best, but the baristas are pretty fast and friendly.  If you hang around and smoke in front, be aware that there is a smoking nazi behind the counter.  I only say this because he's just trying to do his job and respect the rules of Starbucks as well as the city.  They only thing about this place that bugs me, aside from smoking nazi, is the fact that women customers are fucking slobs when it comes to the bathroom.  Seriously? Does everything need to be on the floor? Do you have to leave your pee on the toilet seat?  Do you have to have your [lesbian] sexing in the bathroom?  Yeah, I know what you did in there - have some class.  C'mon... it's Starbucks not a taco dump. Clean up after yourself for fucks sake.

Anyway... Hella parking and open 24 hours = +1 star.
author: shannon s.

description:
No BueNO!! no! No!
I am very picky coming getting my coffee. I want my speciality drink to be non-fat, extra hot, no foam, vanilla latte. 
Well, this place failed miseraberlly at it. I think they made my drink with no non fat milk, just with vanilla, and ugh the shots of coffee, because I can taste the sweet sweet vanilla and half a empty cup and slurping down foam... maybe it was the bartista.. i give it the benefit of the doubt... so one star will suffice for now... *sigh* until next time.
author: Monika T.

description:
I have spent 16 hours straight at this particular branch of my favorite way-to-piss-a-hippie-off. Here's the deal: You tell me a Starbuck's stays open 24 hours and I'm like, "AWESOME! Dude, I can get a freakin venti caramelatto-chocoletta frappuccino at 3 in the effin morning if I feel like it!!!"
In reality, the only reason you want anything from Starbuck's at 3 a.m. is:
a. You are a student and therefore not allowed to sleep 
b. You are a tweaker and therefore not able to sleep
c. You have insomnia and you haven't slept since the 90s

My excuse is (a. student) and I can't describe to you the degree of depravity at this particular Starbuck's at 3 a.m. during finals week...it's serious. Like I said: I was there for 16 hours, 12 coffees, and approximately 3 trips to the bathroom to vomit from nerves and lack of sleep. 
This Starbuck's is overrun with the stroller crowd during daylight, teenage strumpets from Pac Heights and Seacliff during the evening hours, and (again) suicidal, sleep-deprived students from 10 p.m. til the sun comes up. What a cash cow this location has turned out to be.

I am Starbuck's biggest fan (complain to someone else, tree huggers!!!)  and I am so pleased that this location gives all of us zombie academics a place to comiserate, ponder jumping off the golden gate bridge, and endure massive anxiety attacks in a group setting. What a great alternative to the campus library.
author: Autumn K.

description:
This starbucks is open 24 hours. Are people in this neighborhood so addicted to caffeine that they need this place open 24 hours? Everyone in this neighborhood is old or has a kid, what is the deal? You'd think MY neighborhood, full of people who actually DO things after 10pm would have a 24 hour option, but no, these fuckers get a Starbucks. Don't they have enough already? 

I came here because, on my ROTD day, I was at an all day meeting and though my company says they have wi-fi, it doesn't work,  so I came here during the break to build up my self esteem through your fabulous compliments (THANK YOU!!) and wouldn't you know it? It is IMPOSSIBLE to steal wi-fi in this neighborhood. And you know I am not paying for T-Mobile. I am just a lowly 94117-er. Can't you give me some of your wifi, just for a few minutes??

I will never have your life, Laurel Villagers! If I get pregnant, it won't be a life of mommy & me & parenting classes at CPMC, it'll be a decision between RU-486 and a D & E. My occupation will never be "the ceo of my family".  Just give a girl a fuckin' break.  I allow you, when you are in your 20s, to drink beer in my neighborhood and vomit all over the streets. Please just give me some wi-fi when I do some traveling. Please?

Coffee sucks, as usual. And my sandwich was soggy. Ugh.
author: Maria D.

description: This is a pretty nice starbucks. They have a lot of space and the coffee aint bad either!
author: Frank L.

description:
Positives: It's big and you can find a place to sit, which is awesome. You can also sit on a couch or beside one of the many windows to people-watch, which is nice sometimes. 

Negative: Seeing how Starbucks is a multi-billion dollar enterprise, you would think they would offer free Wi-Fi to paying neighborhood customers. 

I will never come here to do work again because of this. There are so many independently owned coffee shops with FREE WI-FI! I would rather give them my business any day.
author: Chantal H.

description: open 24 hours!! wuuhuu
author: Carla F.

description:
My favorite Starbucks. I'm not basing my review on the food and beverages because a Starbucks is a Starbucks. Instead, I'm giving this Starbucks five stars because: It's in one of the nicest neighborhoods in the city, there's parking, there are plenty of seats and it's 24 hours.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
One sad note of correction for you all: this isn't TRULY open 24 hours-- on Sunday nights (or technically, Monday mornings) these guys close at 1 a.m. I don't blame them, but I do want to point out that my fellow yelpers led me to believe that I would score some wifi and workspace before my Monday morning deadline... nope.  Back on the scooter I went.

I'm going to give this place three stars, though, because though this may be one of the nicer Starbucks in town, and they get why people go there (there are plugs galore and the place is just built to house a lot of students), the number of people there on any night is unbearable.  When students are fighting over ottomans to sit on--without a tabletop in front of them--it's a flag to the corporate planners that there is a need for more of these sorts of locations that cater to hard-working night owls.
author: Chris B.

description:
I drive past this place regularly between 11PM and Midnight, and it is PACKED with my fellow classmates. 
I wonder, why do their parents (or they) even bother to pay rent, when they are spending most of their study hours spending $10-15 per visit to this Starbucks? Just a thought. 
On weekend mornings it's a zoo too, on weeknights you're lucky to even find a place to sit for ten minutes.... 
Drive over to Cafe Bazaar on California near 20th for a *much* nicer cafe experience.... 

*************
Ooh, I just read below that there are now TWO bathrooms... perchance it is 'safer'?? 
I haven't bet on it (yet) but I'll update as soon as I venture there again.. 

My initial thought is that two bathrooms just mean more bathroom for them (not) to clean. 

*************
I'm not the biggest fan of the jolly green giant coffee empire which is Starbucks, but my issue with this particular starbucks has NOTHING to do with their evil splenda filled empire... 

It has to do with their bathroom. 

It is DISGUSTING!!!! Ok, fine, it's a 24-hour joint so perhaps my expectations for the facilities need to be brought down a bit, but HONEST TO goodness.... what SANE person would consume food or beverage in this place, much less bring a perfectly innocent child and his or her super sized SUV stroller in this joint (It would need to be disinfected afterwards!) 

I'm assuming that the workers use the same facilities, in which case, I would highly question the health codes that are violated in this place. The bathrooom incessantly smells like urine or fecal matter, and it's amazing that patrons put up with it! 

Totally, totally, gross.
author: M'ia K.

description: I'm becoming more and more in love with this place. I always find a comfortable seat here now! Been here 4 days/week lately. Yesterday was nice. The server gave us another pastry cause they accidentally broke it. It's just the thought of common courtesy that counts!
author: Vivian L.

description:
The tides are turning. 

I'm not a Starbucks guy, never will be, but my girl loves their iced tea. I decided to grab her one this morning.

In the instances over the years when a Starbucks was the only option, I've always refused to order with their ridiculous sizing system. At this point I probably even know the sizes by name.

But today I went in to get that tea, and the girl taking my order recognized my grogginess. As I ordered the drink she pointed at the cups and asked, "Big or little?" 

Brothers and sisters, please continue to order your Starbucks drinks in small, medium and large and we will wipe this ridiculous system off the map forever.
author: Jason R.

description:
I used to work here!

And I loved this job. I loved serving the construction workers in the morning and the students in the afternoon. I loved waving at the little babies in their strollers. Most of all I loved taking orders. I had a trademark flower that I wore in my hair everyday and everybody knows I smile all the time so how could you not want to give your order to me? I don't know what they do at other Starbucks but it seemed like the work of our staff was a ittle more heightened. We all really looked out for each other. Milk containers were replaced not refilled. Sugar containers were always full. Spills are mopped up and tables wiped down. It was a simpler time.

Now that I no longer work here, I am a patron whenever I visit. It's still pleasant. It's still a long wait on a Saturday morning. They still call you by name and it's still a personal coffee experience. Open 24 hours. A large staff. A large cafe space. And beautifully laid out. Puppies wait outside for their owners. Californians rejoice that your coffee is not taxed and way cheaper than New York City!

I love this 'bucks. Always will.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Trendy. Expensive. Weak Coffee. 

Do you want this? 

-Enough said.

On a positive note, I do like that they are some cute girls who frequent this place...late nights.
author: Stanley K.

description:
I grew up in Seattle. I started drinking coffee when I was 4 (one of the many things my grandmother handed down to me - entertaining, shoe shopping, fast talking and coffee drinking). As such, it is only appropriate and expected that i like Starbucks. Don't start screaming at me about Pete's. 

I do. I like Starbucks. I especially like that there is a Starbucks 4  blocks from my house and I can lace up my Nikes and walk my grouchy morning self down there.

However.

Why is it that every single morning, if you are to stroll in any time between, say, 7AM and 11AM, the staff at this Starbucks looks genuinely surprised to see the large amount of customers that are in the store? Every darn morning, the line starts exceeding 20 soon-to-be-caffeinated business types and moms with strollers. The line goes out the door. And there is always one dude apologizing and ringing people up and one chick bagging fat free muffins and one completely crazed looking chick operating the milk steaming machine.
Every day, same routine  Look of bewilderment in their eyes like "Dear God! Did Pete's down the street run out of sugar? Is $12/hour worth fighting off this mob?"

Dear Starbucks Corporate:  these poor people need some help! Your brain-washing, ahem, I mean marketing has paid off really well and this store is super busy. The medical staff from the hospital down the street come here to stay awake, the nearby students spend hours and hours here studying, the 1,267,567,562 new moms in the neighborhood stroll in their bambinos and fret over binkie options. The rest of us poor working class stiffs just need some coffee. Maybe you could put in some sort of Express Lane, "Ten Seconds of Patience or Less. Cash Only"
author: Megan L.

description:
Open 24hours.  2 stars.
Free parking lot.  1 star.
Quick service.  1star.
No homeless asking you for change, and not having to hear them cuss at you when you tell them you really have no change on you, 1 star.
And i ran outta star for their roomy sitting area.
author: Tadaa T.

description:
This is the only 24 hour Starbucks of which I am aware.

As a night owl, I'm always glad to visit at 3:30 AM or whenever. It's spacious and I have found the staff to be consistently friendly. As for the food and drinks, it's pretty much standard Starbucks fare. A nice little nighttime oasis....

I have mixed feelings about Starbucks as a chain -- mostly positive, but some negative.  I remember seeing a cartoon in the New Yorker (?) in which two people are sitting at a table in a Starbucks.  One asks the other, "Are we in this Starbucks or the Starbucks up the street??"  Yes, there are plenty of them.

But I give this one five stars for being open 24 hours and for having a courteous staff -- it's not always easy to be courteous at 4 AM, but they seem to do a good job of it!
author: Brett R.

description:
The only 24 hour Starbucks I know of, and with a very pleasant and polite staff. 

Usually my friends and I catch up here on breaks back from college, over various frappucino's and white chocolate mocha's. It's always clean and always cozy, especially in the whee hours of the night. I wouldn't recommend coming around midterms or finals time as all the crazy college students are cracked up on caffeine and anything as much as a cough will yield death stares.
author: Jordann G.

description: I've recently started drinking more Starbucks cause I want their  gold card. Lame reason, I know. Anyway, I came here after my dad's visit to the SF Endoscopy Center down the street. It was about 8am, so they were busy. Though the line was long, they were able to take my order and make my drink fairly quickly. What's cool is that the workers here recognize the regulars and greet them by name. How friendly of them! I also like that this location is open 24 hours a day--perfect for a study sesh.
author: Audrey T.

description:
This place is great, the staff is always friendly as heck dispite the buttload of people that line up and seem to act angry and rushed.

Bathrooms are clean, plenty of room, just not during finals. 

Thank you employees at this starbucks!
author: Steven C.

description:
24hrs! 24hrs!!!!  Did I say 24hrs!?  That is what rocks... there is parking... but the minus 1 star is for the tabling hogging college students who think that having one drink allows them to stay there for 5 hours. They really need to find a way to make seating available for all... it just doesn't seem fair not to be able to enjoy your drink and go.  I know USF has plenty of places for you to go study.. I went there! The staff is cool too.. and for some reason it seems to be a cop hangout.. so I feel safe knowing there are licensed gun holders around just in case it is needed... just don't aim that thing at me! 

The staff is friendly too... for a late late night place to go have coffee... this place works for me.. ;-) Alas... it is a chain... but I am not a coffee drinker... not a hard core one... so their coffeee is ok for me.
author: Amelia M.

description:
The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because its TOO popular, given its the only 24 hr starbeezies in the area. That being said, recently i've found some good seating there (probably bc I was there for like 8 hrs at a time...ugh.) (and let me just say that grad school can't be worth the pain of the whole app process. ok jk i take that back, i know its worth it. School, please let me in.) 

Parking is definitely manageable after 6 bc its free street and there's a lot in the back. During the day, this starbucks is not worth it. Meter parking (bleh) and the lot in the back has a 90 min limit and a $65 ticket or something. (big bucks) Not worth it to come out here to study before 6. Tons of outlets and the normal starbucks wifi (ATT-free for ATT DSL customers- and tmobile). all in all, people should get lives and go home (so lamers like me can study more. haha)
author: Grace G.

description: Great 24 hr starbucks! There are a lot of med/law students here studying... The only downside is it gets really crowded between 9-11pm. If you plan to get a spot here get here before or after those times. The baristas are really nice, especially the girl with short brown hair.
author: Daisy J.

description: The staff at this one rocks.  I give it three stars because there are always SO MANY annoying people there studying.  I simply do not understand why people find it fun to study in a Starbucks  It is 24 hours and near USF and lots of high schools, but it is so crowded.  If you are going to meet another person (god forbid) to chat and have a coffee, you'd best be going to take your coffee elsewhere or standing around awkwardly while the studying people rearrange in a less spread out way.
author: Julia D.

description:
3.5 stars for their barista skills in making drinnks.. WHY? because often times my latte/frap/machiatto would come out flavorless!

4-4.5 stars for their location - hours for operation - parking

starbucks on california is a great hangout spot for latenight chitchats and homework or studying. plenty of parking. there are lots of tables and the baristas there are friendly + great customer service. 

what i dont like about this starbucks.
-caffeine beverages are sometimes very bland (and i feel bad to have them remake it so i just take whatevers there =( ) 
-the music is not soothing for sh*t, cant they play some more goodies from 96.5 or something? some slowjams or lightrock would be nice...
author: Jo L.

description: Open 24 hours a day, wow. What can I say? If this Starbucks was at my neighborhood, I'd probably be a regular especially on nights when I couldn't sleep and feel like writing. Sometimes I feel the need to be out where there are people since writing can be a lonely experience. And to be in this cafe where a lot of people seem to be doing their own thing on their laptops can be encouraging. So for sure, this Starbucks is definitely high on my list as one of my most favorite Starbucks. In addition, even though it is street parking, I did not have a hard time finding a parking spot. Maybe this only applies at night, but in San Francisco, to find a parking spot on the street easily is so very important.
author: Christopher R.

description:
Even in a Sunday night ay 9pm labor day weekend its full of people. Seems like a very nice, cozy place to get a drink and hang out. But very hard to get a seat at night, the one time I was in the area.

So its 24 hour Mon-Sat, and till 1am Sun night? Cool. I need to remember that.
author: Dijon Y.

description:
I spent a lot of money here, so that I would never have to come back.  Let me explain: I came in with a friend and picked up an espresso machine, some beans, and a coffee grinder.

The person behind the counter cheerfully helped us out.  Even though there was a decent line, she came to give us the skinny on the different products and functions of each machine.  Pretty awesome.  

From what I could tell, and I'm by no means a connoisseur, they had a fair assortment of machines.  Unfortunately, the coffee grinder I got was out of stock, so I had to settle for the one on the shelf.  Nothing a good wash couldn't cure.

The best part was that I got hooked up with employee discount.  w00t!  Now I can enjoy lattes every morning and I don't even have to leave the house...
author: Tony L.

description:
Ok, this place might be my stomping ground if I had time and babies.

But I don't.

If you are usually on the run and don't have time to wait around, don't go to this Starbucks. It once took me 25 minutes to get my coffee. I know because I put money in the parking meter, and I ran out of time. This Starbucks is right by my house, and the parking situation is usually decent. You can pretty much find parking here in the mornings. However, it's so much quicker for me to drive down to Fillmore, find parking, and pick up my Coffee Bean. For this reason alone, I dread going to this Starbucks.

There's also no chance of getting any work done here. Babies and toddlers are running around and screaming. Moms are trying to make the most time out of their outing of the morning and chatting it up with other moms. 

The coffee here tastes burnt, and the other drinks are always too sweet. Don't go here if you can avoid it. 

The only plus side is that this Starbucks is the only one in the area that is open almost 24/7. That might be because it's next to two hospitals.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
THIS is my local Starbucks.  It sits at the end of Laurel Village with some grand, brooding quality, as if it knows everyone around it hates it, but they'll still inevitably go to it.

(I've spent some time thinking about this, and have come to a conclusion. There are four coffee shops on this specific block(Lo Cubano, Petes, Cafe Rigolo, and Starbucks). The mothers and fathers are too scared of the newness of Lo Cubano, Petes has no sitting area, and Rigolo offerst too many -OH NO- fattening goodies.  So everyone to starbucks)

As I am originally a suburbanite, I can tolerate a Starbucks.  I don't like it, but I do.  But this one, oh, it's just...obnoxious.

It's not so much the baristas or the overpriced drinks that get to me, it's the crowd.  High strung men and women, often toting along some accesory like a briefcase, an old laptop, or a kid on a leash. Grumbling in line. Bad attitudes all around. 

You almost feel sorry for the staff, and perhaps that's why I continue to go there.  To offer a smile as I order my Grande Iced Non-fat Caramel Macchiato With Extra Caramel to that poor bewildered teenager behind the counter as he gets badgered by an unending line of grumpy elders.
author: Carly S.

description:
Sitting here at 6:43 on a monday evening, I could go on and on about how Starbucks is the devil and blah blah blah...  
When I feel like I NEED a cup of coffee, I'd sell my eyeballs for 8 ounces of hot caffeinated anything.

If I were a student;  If I were a smoker;  If I lived within 10 blocks of this location;  I'd make this my home.  I'm not though.  I've been here twice.
author: Patrick A.

description: Great service. Feels like cheers. "where everybody knows your name." This review was long over due. Gene, Mr. Gentle giant always a sweetheart. Helen, so quick and always has my drink perfectly made down to the last drop of foam. Sandra spunky little fun size pack of skittles,always full of personality. Keith, so efficient and such a charmer.
author: JUDY H.

description:
I keep claiming I hate starbucks. but this is the 2nd in a week that I'm giving a positive review for (and unfortunately it's going to be 3 soon, damn you Outer Richmond starbucks!). That's it, I give up.

I. Love. Starbucks. I love your lackluster coffee, your bad choice of food, your often annoying and rude barristas. At this particular destination it's the ample seating, 24 hour openness, and the fact that your packed to the gills at all times (seriously, you made me realize how many other students live in my neighborhood.) Look I like the ability to get caffeine at 3am.

Now I've got no beef with Maria D. -- but I love Laurel Heights. It's like Yuppie Light, perfect for me and my special brand of quasi-gonzo-revolutionary-intellectualism. Although I will say this, yeah most of the people that live here suck.  "Laurel Heights - Hey, we're better than Glen Park"
author: Tyler W.

description:
I love places that are open 24 hours...nothing like it. I'm a vampire don'cha know!! So I bring my cousin and her friend over here one night for late night discussions and coffee. My cousin at the time had been dating a friend of mine and she was going through a phase. I like to play devil's advocate and instigated a conversation. I guess her friend didn't take too kindly to my line of thought when she would TRY to rebuke me. She had taken it way to personally....my cousin and I were having a good time running with it...partially because we were getting such a reaction out of her friend. 

My cousin later told me that her friend hates me with a passion. It's too bad, I thought she was cute. Nothing good happens after 2am...lmao

2 stars because it's open late....really late
author: John-Michael C.

description:
What better way to start your morning off after an early workout??....

Coffee, of course!

I love the location of this Starbucks because it's literally 24 steps away from the 24 hour Fitness on California Street I go to.  Yes, there's a plethora of coffee places along Fillmore, but I chose Starbucks because I wanted to feel less guilty after sweatin' it out at the gym. So I ordered the skinny cinnamon dolce latte for only 90 calories.  I saved on the calories, but not so much on my wallet...a tall for $3.35. 

Love the location, friendly staff. They get you in and out so that you can rush off to your next destination.
author: Lisa C.

description:
NOT open 24/7... they close for 3 hours on sunday night, so i walked 6 blocks, freezing my ass off, to not have my favorite drink when i was having trouble sleeping. booo!!

Update: i just realized i had a one start rating for this place for hella long! I super appreciate this starbucks location for their hours and for how big they are. I've come here multiple times for study sessions and, although it is super crowded, we always seem to carve out a couple seats for us.

the only thing that is unnerving about this place is the amount of cops that come here.
author: A. H.

description:
3 stars, because they run a tight ship, extra star for friendly baristas and being open 24/7.

You'll see a ton of PoPos because of the 24/7 so feel safe here.  This place is packed at night when schools in session so you might have to stalk for a table.  The music is not blaring here, thank you jebus.  Also, there is a good amount of seating here.

Park in back or park on the street.
Drink, talk, study or whatever.
author: Po L.

description:
Fyi, this location now has gluten-free Valencia Orange Cake for $2.  Pretty delicious.

Not sure if all Starbucks carries them now or not, as I do not frequent Starbucks.
author: Mrs F.

description: I went here last week during a really busy time of the day, and the quality of service has greatly improved.  The cashiers were very nice and helpful and the drinks came out quickly despite the crowd.  Awesome job management did making improvements.
author: M R.

description: I don't really have coffee often unless I'm having to be up early for work, but this place used to be in my neighborhood and stayed open late. And just for the fact that I had a very close friend who worked here that I used to visit, I'll give it 4 stars for the memories.
author: Petra S.

description:
(As many a Yelp review has started....)  If I could give no stars, I would.  Well, I guess the one star could count for their 24-hour location.

It's across the street from the gym and my mom always puts Starbucks cards in my stocking at Christmas.  Hence, the reason I stop.  It always takes too long.  They always screw it up.  They always have a bad attitude.

But one day, they took it too far.  The coffee machine at work was broken and I needed to pick up one of their travel cases for the office.  I know that takes a while to fill so I always call ahead to whatever location I'm hitting up.  

It was 6am; I told the girl I'd be there at 7:30--could they have it ready?  She doesn't put me on hold, just covers the mouthpiece and rudely screams the information to a co-worker.  Back to me, yes, they could have it ready.  7:30 for Melissa.

After waiting in their atrocious line, I get to the front at 7:35.  I'm Melissa and you've got to be joking me that you have no coffee waiting for me!  "We forgot."  No "I'm sorry."  No "Could you use a cup of coffee while you wait for our incompetent asses to make what you requested an hour and a half ago?"  No, just smug looks and the slowest service ever.  If I didn't HAVE to have it, I would have torn them a new one right there and walked out.  

I wrote to their headquarters about the situation.  They did send a gift card (goodie, another one--*groan*).  The amount?  $10.  Hey buddy, that damn traveler is $13 and my aggravation is worth a whole lot more!

Damn, I'm getting heated about this still!
author: Melissa Q.

description:
I never knew that a green tea latte has this unnatural, neon green color to it. I have been enlightened. 

I recommend a grande; there's enough sugar in there to give an 80-year old man an artery-bursting erection for 6 hours.
author: Frank B.

description:
I've been to a lot of Starbucks and have to say, this one has the friendliest staff!  The furniture is nice, the coffee is great, and they serve the new breakfast sandwiches.  

Oh yeah - this one is open 24 hours a day!
author: Anthony B.

description: I usually only come here around 11pm. The workers are friendly and always try to remember my drink which is nice. Love love love that they are 24 hours! Night shift workers dream!
author: Kelly B.

description: Coffee, 24hrs a day! Best place for late night caffeine! Even at 2am the baristas are perky. Line can get long during the day but overall a great Sbux!
author: Maya L.

description:
This is my favorite Starbucks in San Francisco mainly because it is 24-hours.

If you like to bring your laptop and do some work, this is the place though tables are pretty hard to come by because of its proximity to UCSF (or is it SFSU?).

Trying to work here during the day is not pleasant as it gets a lot of foot traffic. At night, there are a lot of students here doing their homework.

I have spent late night/early morning jaunts here a couple of times. One was when I can't find parking for my car in Lower Haight so I decided to spend the night here and the other was to watch the recent Australian Open Final between Nadal and Federer because my internet was out and I have no cable.

The staff are very friendly and they try to keep the place clean.
author: Dan R.

description: your 24 hour starbucks, anytime and day... there open for you, woot hoot... except for monday's 1am-4am which closed for cleaning :P
author: JessePanda C.

description:
This is exactly identical to almost every other Starbucks I've ever been in, except with a much longer line.  I shouldn't have to wait that long for coffee that bad.  I have it on good scientific authority that coffe costs about  64 cents a gallon to brew, theres no reason to sell it for $4.50 a cup, no matter how much syrup, ice and whipped cream you add.


http://www.cockeyed.com/inside/coffee/coffee.html
author: Herbert S.

description:
Starbucks Would get ZERO stars if that were an option.

Dear Yelp reader please find below a letter I sent to Starbucks regarding their company.  I was sent a form letter in response and it didnt address any the questions raised in my letter!!! 

March 21, 2008

Mr. Howard D. Schulz
Founder, Chairman, Chief Executive Officer & President
Starbucks Corporation
2401 Utah Avenue South
Seattle, Washington 98134

 Re: Starbucks Stock

Dear Mr. Schulz:

 I am a shareholder of Starbucks stock and am writing you in an attempt to understand why my investment has lost over half of its value in less then two years.  Let me start by saying I purchased your stock because I was a longtime consumer of your product.  I enjoyed the coffee and the atmosphere that Starbucks offered.  After some financial research I thought it wise to invest in your company.  

 At that time Starbucks was not only selling coffee and teas but also divesting into the compact disc market and selling refrigerated drinks in grocery stores.  Starbucks even had a coffee store in China's Forbidden City (quite a feat!).

 Since April 2006, when I invested in your company the stock has done nothing but drop.  I've included a chart in case you needed a visual.  It's gotten so bad that when I see the stock only slip 5 or 10 cents on a given day I think it's a victory.

 Now, you've just lost a lawsuit requiring you to pay $100 million in back tips to your employees.  I don't normally make a habit of writing letters to the CEO's of a company I own stock in, but in this case I've made an exception.  I need my voice to be heard and I can no longer sit on the proverbial sidelines and watch this company dump my investment.  

What are you going to do to turn this around?  Tell me; what future plans do you have that will right this sinking coffee company.  

Or should I just sell what little of my investment is left and join the growing membership of those dissatisfied with big corporate business. If that is ultimately what happens I can tell you that there will be no more of the proverbial sideline for me, I will be vocal, but not for you.  

Thank you for your time in reading this letter and I would appreciate a response. 


Regards,

Chris G. 
Shareholder

So let's all go somewhere else for coffee now!! 

Who's with me!! hehee
author: Chris G.

description:
Extra star only for being open 24 hours.
It saved me during finals and the week before.
Recently redone to accommodate more people.
Coffee still mediocre Starbucks, but at 4am caffeine is caffeine.
During normal hours I'll be down the street at Lo Cubano or Peet's.
author: Emily P.

description:
I would rate this Starbucks a 4.5 but it's just not that great to round up. 5 stars for being the ONLY 24hr Starbucks in SF but 4 stars for barely having enough seats. I know they could add at least another table for us all-nighters then again it is a small place.. sorta.

They just recently "re-designed" the place and quite frankly, I think the previous layout was waaaaaay better, but I guess I can't really complain if that's the only Starbucks that will service what I want at the ass crack BEFORE dawn-- before because I'm just a vampire like that. Who the hell wakes up during the day anyway!?
author: Janell Y.

description:
this is quite a quirky starbucks.  it must be because they're 24/7.  they got rid of my favorite dessert pastry ever - the classic coffee cake.  No! - not the one they have now, but the one that used to be squarish, big, and tasty.  those were the days.

this particular location also seems to attract a lot of the...nerdy crowd.  not the crowd that enjoys the sunday times, or reads the latest palahniuk novel.  it's more like the same crowd that would wait 3 days ahead in line for the new star wars movie.  you see where i'm going with this?

also, pike place coffee sucks.  i hope they get rid of it.  i'm heading to peet's up the street.
author: Ash C.

description:
I used to go to this Starbucks for a whole semester in the mornings before school, now I got too lazy and instead buy those bottled Frappuccino things instead. 

It's way easier to find parking here in the mornings, before 9 am. After that, good luck. Even the lot in the back is pretty full, but that's only because it's surrounded by a bunch of stores as well. 

You won't always find a seat here even though the inside is pretty big. Seems to be a popular place to go in the area. 
This place was always crowded, but the baristas tried very hard to get everyone their drinks and have them out in no time. Some of them even remembered my name when I came in. 

It's not amazing, but it's not as bad as some of the other locations I have been to in the city.
author: Bella S.

description:
Okay. This is SO lame of me to review this... but I HAD the BEST breakfast here yesterday. This isn't served in all the Starbucks locations, but this is offered here in Laurel Village. I've seen this in other Starbucks, so if you run across one in the morning... you must give it a try.

The sausage, cheddar, egg breakfast sandwich on a English muffin is DELICIOUS!!! It's SO yummy... It's served toasted and piping hot! I love how it's so crispy on the outside. I savored every bite.... With my breakfast sandwich in one hand and a tall latte in another, I swear my Sunday morning couldn't have been any better.

In addition, they also offer many varieties of breakfast sandwiches: spinach and egg Florentine, bacon and cheddar, and ham, egg and cheese.
author: Denise L.

description:
oh BOY.

So this is my (new) neighborhood Starbucks.  and, true to form, ALWAYS BUSY.  Full of strollers, toddlers, crumby screamers, sullen teenagers, and various other characters.
God, i love it.

They have all my treats.  The staff is sweet.  That's all I need.

OH.  And they're open 24 hours.  If ever I should need such a thing...
author: Alison R.

description: It's great that it is open all night and has plug ins and wifi! But the staff is often curt and immature and there seems to be ALOT of them working all at once. I just came from there and they had no coffee made and thought it was funny that I found that exasperating. I packed my stuff up and left. They are, afterall, a coffee shop with 2 regular coffee makers. Why in the world can that many workers allow the coffee to run out? And then get smarmy about.
author: Vince's S.

description:
Review for Starbucks

Clean Service from another big boring liberal progressive multinational conglomerate helping to warm the earth.
  
I don't know how anyone can drink coffee if the say they believe in global warming.  There is no excuse for cutting down the forest, building a coffee plantation, fertilizing/ pesticiding (petro chemicals) and use a fossil fuels to ship the stuff half way around the world so you can drink it.  You don't need coffee!  You could drink water.  With that said, I don't believe in that global warming hogwash, so I can enjoy my drink of choice.  If I see you there, I'll know you don't care about global warming too and we can toast to our fossil fuel SUV's with abandon or even worse the earth destroying Prius.  (read the down and dirty on the Prius here http://clubs.ccsu.edu/recorder/editorial/print_item.asp?NewsID=188)  

So many coffee/ tea houses burn the crap out of the tea leaves with too hot water, or by leaving the bags in for a long period of time (yes I could stick my fingers in and yank the bag or the  melted straws used to dangle the bag out but it's too frakking hot and messy.)  All these practices used by these big liberal-progressive-democrat-supporting-ozone-destroying-global-warming-multinational-corporations like Starbucks make the tea become bitter.  These liberal progressive multinationals are too busy trying to make money pushing out 3-4 buck latts to the clients who are destroying the planet to use proper tea making protocol for the low profit margin drinks like the more earth friendly teas.  So it may your tea weak like the science behind global warming, but yank the tea out of the cup quick or you will become bitter like AL Gore.

Meg says the coffee here is acceptable but prefers Peets.   I don't particularly prefer the tea here, but I do appreciate the clean nice atmosphere.  The great muffins and breakfast sandwiches (soon to be ax'd?) make this a decent choice for a breakfast alternative to a sit down restaurant.   The kids and I don't like the hot coco here as it's more bitter-grainy euro-styled than American (funny that I prefer my chocolate euro styled but hot-coco American.)  Anyway I still do enjoy my Tea here and I know that every cup I drink makes me a little warmer inside and the planet a little warmer too.  Whether it's coco, coffee or tea enjoy your next cup!  I know I will!
author: jack w.

description:
THIS STARBUCKS IS GOING OFF!  IT IS THE BOMB-DIGGITY SHIZZZZNIT!  LAUREL HEIGHTS, HOLLA!

I'm not kidding.  This place is actually the epicenter of all social activity in Laurel Heights.

Yeah, sure it's kinda lame that this is the most poppin' place in Laurel Heights.  But oh well, what are you going to do?  Laurel Heights is "MacLaren StrollerLand" and I'm not going to hate on Starbucks for providing caffeinated beverages 24 hours a day to all the moms in workout clothes and their kids with perfect color-coordinated crocs.

I don't function without an injection of coffee and I love that Starbucks is only a few blocks from my home.
author: Ellen B.

description:
Not a big fan of Starbucks!!  Wait, I have to admit that I love their"White Chocolate Mocha Flavored Syrup".  Let me rephrase it, "I ONLY love THAT syrup and a special request of two pumps."  Otherwise, way way way too sweet.

Starbucks is Starbucks.  A chain is a chain.  
But this one.....this one has its niche,
1) 24hr--
2) Easy parking in the front, the side, and the back.  
3) Huge seating area 
4) Nice street view with big clear windows

I enjoy coming here Sunday morning sitting in a corner reading my favorite book and observing the activities through the big screens, people, dogs, infants, trees, flowers, cars, even the chairs, all seems alive..... THE WORLD IS VIVID. 

I gave it 5 stars for it's location~
I will come here again NOT because it's Starbucks.

PS.  I only went there ONCE!  THAT Sunday morning ~~ Bleh!
author: Smiley W.

description:
Back in the old days when this Starbucks still has booths inside, it felt so much more like the "Third Place" enviornment they try to convey.  However, now there are seats everywhere and couches in the middle of the floor, it's almost impossible to walk through the store.  

Gotta give it to them for being a 24-hr store though, and the service is actually pretty good!
author: Karina L.

description: The central location and 24-hours of operation make this Starbucks the ideal one for me. Nothing like grabbing something hot to drink after a long night out. And the people that frequent this Starbucks are true characters, I've met some very interesting and cool people here.
author: Alldaron K.

description: This is one of my favorite  STARbucks! They have some Stars workin there!  JoJo and Keith are awesome everytime I come in! They know how to give awesome service and make the environment so fun! This is a busy store but good atmosphere, whether you are wanting to study during the late hours or sit and people watch it's all entertaining!!! Wooo  for this starbucks!
author: Natalie R.

description:
This place is good. Quiet and the staff are down to earth. It's right inside the Wells Fargo Bank so you can get some money and drink your fix..( ok theres no pun in that one) 
Open table area and very relaxing. Clean place.
My choice.
author: Smooth R.

description:
I like this place because it's opened 24 hours.  

Plus it recently got renovated this week and it now offers more workspace!  Yay!  More work nights at the Starbucks!

And of course now if you get a Starbucks card you get free wi-fi.  

Note this is all about the work friendly hours and workspace at this Starbucks.  Not about the quality of coffee.
author: Alan T.

description:
love this starbucks!

have stopped by during late night hours, and it's a good setup with lots of chairs and individual tables that maximize the space.  

the decor is clean and modern, yet warm.

was here weds 9am and the place was run like a well oiled machine!  everyone was friendly, quick and accurate.  i even heard a "pardon my reach" from one of the cashiers.  thought i spotted a little girl carrying a brown balloon (from starbucks??)  either way, both are a first!

this location is now first on my list for future starbucks' runs.
author: Josie M.

description: awesome place to get your studying done, this starbucks can get a bit crowded, which makes it hard for people to find a seat to settle down with their drink and hit the books. i'd definitely recommend this place for anyone who needs a place to study at because they offer free wi-fi !!
author: Jeff C.

description:
I was originally very anti-Starbucks, and wrote that I hoped that San Francisco would be the first city in America where everyone would say "NO!" to corporate conglomerations and (in Starbuck's case), frequent only our local independent coffee shops. 

HOWEVER, I changed my one star to five after doing some research and discovering that they give a ton of $ to very worthy causes and treat their employees well.. 

I still don't care for their coffee but I'd go in and buy my bottled water there!
author: Lala B.

description:
Very close and I can walk to this 24 hour Starbucks just blocks away.  What do you expect other than it is, just some place to read, study, meetup, kick it, and actually have some coffee.  
Oh, can park my  motorcycle on the sidewalk without any issues.
author: James H.

description:
I like places that are open late, have decent coffee, (really over the coffee snobs) offer internet service, some food and a reasonable amount of places to sit-I'm easy to please.  This Starbucks is all of the above with the added plus of being open 24 hours.  No matter how hard I try, my circadian rhythm just peaks late at night.  Therefore, I appreciate establishments open late because there are so few.

The crowd is a conglomeration of people.  In walks: students, couples, ghetto-fab wannabes, punks, yuppies, fams w/kids and a smattering of some older professionals.  I just stick in my earplugs, playing either classical or techno music (mostly) and studdy away.
author: Katherine P.

description:
Open 24 hours yippiee!!  (3 open 24 hrs)

Positives:  Big store, lots of seating; carries lots of cups and such which is fun as it gives me something to browse while a take 5; has two nice big public bathrooms;  no people begging change.  

The negatives;  can be crowded even late night; has a few pkg spaces in front w/meters and some on side street so can be a bit difficult to park;  lots of cops congregate here which can be good or bad depending (driving a cab this also means they are driving around here a lot which is not too good for me :);  employees are allright but not really friendly and never seem to remember me.  they can also have a bit of an attitude
author: Carol O.

description:
During the day, almost impossible to find parking even with the big lot out back. You wouldn't want to come here during the day anyway due to the crawling children, would-be soccer moms, and geriatrics. At night, it isn't much better. Depending on the day of week, the place is either crawling with wannabe mafioso Russians, students slaving away with their heads in books, drunk people post-club, or slackers absorbing the free internet.

Another problem with this Starbucks is due to the fact it's late night hang-out central to some, it's a feat finding some place to sit past 7PM. If you manage to find a seat inside, better have a friend to save your spot if you need to piss. There are benches outside, but beware if you're not a smoker. The spit and butts will no doubt disgust you.

Given how close this Starbucks is to my house (far closer than the quiet, empty, lots of parking 24hr Serramonte Starbucks), I frequent this place often enough to know who works there at night. All the night/early morning baristas are nice and no one I know has ever had a drink order messed up.

If you're already on this side of the city, really need coffee at 3AM and don't want to pay the booth-minimum at Video Cafe, head here. Just don't expect to sit down if it's the weekend.
author: Grace-Monday B.

description:
I have spent many late nights/early mornings studying and writing incredibly long term papers here. If it wasn't for the encouragement of coffee I would never get any work done!
I love this place- the employees are friendly, the green tea latte is great and I love the way the place has been renovated with more room to study.
Thank you for being open 24 hours!!!!
author: Valerie B.

description:
My latest update to my prior reviews of this Starbucks would be entirely too long to post here, so instead here's a link:

http://sarka.tumblr.com/post/818628275/starbucks-laurel-heights
author: Joseph R.

description: 24 hour service thats what help me open my eyes at 5am. before long trip to LA.everything was Nice.Will stop by again!!!
author: Armand A.

description:
great staff but like all other starbuck's long line but longer than usual due to location.

Near hospitals, clinics, UCSF Laurel campus down the block, many young parents with time on their hands.

The staff are amazingly upbeat although overworked.  Good thing there's a Peet's down the block for overflows
author: Ariel W.

description: Starbucks at its best and worst... Good things - open 24/7. Not so good - really crowded during daytime. No easy parking on weekdays if you happen to drive a car from out of area. Now, as a work-from-coffee-place veteran I feel entitled to have some strong opinions about which of those are good spots. My first impression of this one - a coffee factory. High traffic levels. People fighting for a place to grab and work. Pretty descent infrastructure, though. Lots of sockets (unfortunately a major consideration for someone working on media intense, lousy-battery life laptop). Coffee - a matter of taste, but definitely plenty in your immediate reach. Food - never found the Starbucks food appealing. Bottom line - one does not go to Starbucks for food. I don't.  Summing up - good to know the place exists, but definitely not my prime 'office' location, given a choice.
author: Rob R.

description: This place was my second home for about 3 months while studying for my PMP exam. open 24 hrs, free Wifi and comfortable seating. Always clean and friendly staff. there are alot of studious students here making it a great studying environment. O i miss the good old days.
author: Annie S.

description:
it's always fun when girls checking out my tattoos forget to swipe my credit card because they're staring. i almost scored four free coffees here today.

this place is open twenty four hours a day. not sure why this one is open at all hours of the day - it's not as if laurel heights is that bumpin' of a 'hood. but whatever, i'm sure it serves a useful purpose. i know i've been happy with it the three times i've been here lately.

starbuck's DOES need to get off that damn t-mobile network and offer free wi-fi to people. it's not as if they cannot afford it. jerks.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: Maybe I caught them on a bad day but I took the bus to this Starbucks because of the 24 hour nature... Only to betold they were closing in 30 mins after I purchased my drink.  Then after making a terrible version of my drink refused to stir it.  Worst starbuck experience in SF so far!
author: Allen P.

description:
24 hours starbucks. one of the fewest in the city that is  still 24/7! its pretty busy and with that in mind..ifyoure going to come here in the future , and i have to wait for you to finish your ridiculous douche bag order( if youre one of these types  : ) )...please get off your phone, control your baby, ACTUALLY  KNOW what you want to order before you get to the register and hold up the already 25 ft line back into the hallway. 
    oh....and dont get pissed off when the barista cant hear you because of the grinders,people and babies crying all over the place , and asks you to repeat the order... they dont read minds and can not tolerate your spoiled shitty tude. dude...they dont want to hear it  and neither do we :) so save it.


ENJOY your visit here!
author: jason t.

description:
this review is only about the red velvet cupcake.  (i don't really care for or go to  starbucks except for their salted caramel signature hot chocolate)

their red velvet cupcake SUCKS!!!!!  too sweet, overwhelming flavors that clash, too much........like grocery store quality cupcake......yuck!!!!!
author: Cindi N.

description: Why bother reviewing a Starbucks on Yelp? Because it's fantastic. Huge, clean, frequented by a ton of regulars that the baristas know by name --  this place is fantastic. The decor is nice, too -- feels like your run-of-the-mill Starbucks took steriods and got an upscale makeover. Only downfall can be finding a place to settle during the daytime hours. I'm obsessed with this place!
author: Jessica B.

description: A great Starbucks!  Excellent service, lots of friendly smiles, good seating,a dn I got a new favorite brew from their signage: skinny cinna mon dolce latte!
author: Margaret L.

description: The Starbucks here is very nice. There are some outdoor seating, but there is not much. Wifi is free, and the place is often packed. The waiters are usually helpful and nice. You often see college students, adults, and young couples there. Parking can be a pain, but there is a parking lot behind the place.
author: DJ Guan Yu M.

description: Starbucks is my second home. I love coming here and getting my coffee while reading a book. I love the free wifi so I always bring a computer with me. It is definitely a great place to study.
author: Queen E.

description: Good location, always packed though. Sometimes the line is so long you can actually walk a few blocks down the road to get to an independent coffee shop in the same time as you might wait for your turn at this Starbucks. One issue I often have at all Starbucks, tea type drinks are way to hot.
author: dunz r.

description: Starbucks allows guns to be carried openly. I advise everyone to go down the the block to Peet's Coffee & Tea. The coffee is better, the staff is more  professional and it is much safer...no guns there.
author: carol c.

description: A Starbucks is a Starbucks.  But I like that this one is open 24 hours.  I tried to order my usual soy chai latte but they didn't have any soy milk.  Sad.  So I had to order it with low fat milk instead.  But since they didn't have soy, the guy comped me on the drink.  So bonus points for them.  Ample seating, at least on the night that we went.  Crowd seems kinda high schoolish / college-y and asian, but who cares because you're really there to chat with your friends anyway.
author: spiff e.

description: My roommates and I live in the area.. we stopped by Starbucks this morning. I will admit that I am not a daily starbucks customer but, I come here on occassion. My order is not perfected to a science like most starbucks customers.. I ordered 1/2 hot chocolate and 1/2 coffee, something i've ordered before at many different places and have never had a  problem. The lady taking my order was so rude she made me feel like an idiot. Worse, she did the exact same rude attitude to my roommate just after me. It definitely didn't make me want to become one of the daily starbucks customers. Honestly, I expected a lot better customer service for such a busy and well known coffee shop, early on a Wednesday morning. I was too afraid to ask for the manager because it might've been her. She has very blonde hair and small glasses.. watch out!
author: Elaina L.

description: The line is always way too long & even at 11pm every single seat & table is taken by someone with a laptop. I'd rather go the the Walgreens next door for a snack, then walk back home.
author: Melisser E.

description: Ummmm, YES.  I LOVE this Starbucks!  Lots of comfy seating - perfect for doing reportcards the day before they're due, or grabbing an iced latte on the way home from partying.  AND, its 6 blocks from my house.  *w00t*
author: Jennifer L.

description: The biggest starbucks in town that I've been.  They have extensive seating options (with a ton of plugs to handle your laptop) and a Clover machine to make you a fresh brewed cup (at a premium price of course).
author: Sheetal S.

description: Was here tonight and the barista asked me if I wanted whipped cream on top of my hot chocolate instead of putting it on there like they always do.
author: Darius A.

description: This starbucks stands out from others because it's 24 hours. I know some of the people who work there and the environment is really friendly. Nothing better than a VBF and a book to read while sitting on the couch.
author: Brian W.

description:
If I didn't HATE the Starbucks Corporation with a heated passion - I would have given this place 5 stars. Normally - I wouldn't be caught dead ordering a Venti Non-fat Decaf Peppermint White Mocha Frappacino with No Whip. Any coffee drink with more than one or two verbs isn't really coffee now...is it? Really...I'm a Philz Iced Coffee kinda guy. Or Blue Bottle. Something simple of quality. Don't go here for the drinks (at least I wouldn't). Go here cause it's open 24 Hours! If you're a Grad Student - this is as cool a study area as you'll get at 2:00 AM. Seriously, if Hastings, Golden Gate and USF had a common ground - this Starbucks would be it. I'm not a student (my friend was), but I came with a good book and an open mind - and honestly, I really enjoyed myself. Sure beat sitting at home watching the latest Nip/Tuck and reruns of South Park. I still hate the Starbucks Corporation - but you'll probably find me back here after normal business hours. I'll be the guy with an Iced Egg Nog Latte in the corner ducking behind my guilt and shame ;-) No really though...I do like Egg Nog Latte's...

EDIT: Okay - this is the first review I've edited (just adding this portion and taking off one star). I've since been back to  this location. I took a star off because I think they play their music too loud, and in the 2 hours I was sitting there I heard "Chestnuts roasting on an open fire" probably 4 times. It's the holidays - I get it. Play something else. And hey - let's face it. My 2 star review of Starbucks ain't gonna hurt their bottom line.
author: Eli S.

description:
So it's the closest Starbucks to my place, and the added bonus is that it's always open.  However, being that I'm a student and want to do some work here, I can NEVER get a place to sit unless it's at 4AM.  WTF?!  The cashiers/baristas are pretty nice considering they have to deal with the people who come here...

The only added bonus is that there are lots of students/good looking hospital folk who come here.  I just wish I could get a place to sit.
author: Christine H.

description: This is a very solid Starbucks - funny that it is the only late night spot in all of Laurel/Presidio Heights! I'm a big fan of the expanded seating, though I'd say this is not the best spot if you want to sit and gab with a friend vs. get some work done. It has a very "serious" vibe about it, with lots of students and self-employed types bent over laptops. Service is always very fast and friendly - do not fear the long lines!
author: Kiesha R.

description: One of the friendlier, less corporate-feeling Starbucks in this world.  I especially like the plethora of seating options close to the window for people-watching and boyfriend-waiting-for.
author: Kevin S.

description: Five stars for being open 24 hours and for bringing back the Cinnamon Dolce Latte! The staff also makes a killer Blacked Iced Tea (Sweetened)! Yum.....
author: La C.

description:
Generally Starbucks coffee is not my favorite brand of coffee, however I do appreciate the Limited Offer Coffee at the Laurel Village Starbucks. This offering at the Laurel Village 24 hour Starbucks is worthy of calling vintage coffee and the price for a tall which is equivalent to about 8-10 ounces of coffee is very reasonable considering the quality of that limited offer special blend.  I tried the Ethopian and it was delightful!

I like the fact that this coffee location is a 24 hour site and that the neighborhood is central to many medical facilities.  The scones are scrumptious especially the vanilla and maple scones.

I happened to notice that this Starbucks also offers a breakfast sandwich and coffee, which I think is a good idea at a coffee site.  They also have items for lunch and for snacks too.  

I would like them to expand the number of microwave cups that they sell so that the customers who want microwave cups in large sizes will have more of a visual selection of ceramics to choose from. Last time I was in there I purchased the large brown Starbuck Mug with the company name on it.

The seating in this coffee location is really great, you can spread out or choose to be by yourself. There are also areas of seating where you can converse with others if you so choose.

Generally the barristas are efficient; The lines though large at certain key times of the day, move fairly rapidly.

The site is clean, and seems to be well managed.
author: Dee C.

description: Laurel Village Starbucks FOR THE WIN~! because it's close to my house and close to all the other close-by shops which i adore so much. but screw the parking when i can't find any!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! or have to walk really far!
author: Tina L.

description: Seriously, why do you mess up my order EVERY TIME and then look at me like I should just take the messed-up drink and move on? Who manages this store for god's sake?
author: Beth T.

description: THIS Starbucks was completely unredeemable for a long while. I once asked for a coconut frappucino (RIP) and the cashier said, "Excuse me, but we haven't been making those for 6 months!!!" I was really sad and thought his behavior ABSOLUTELY UNCALLED FOR. I had him as a cashier another time too, and he is always in a bad mood. Recently, I went to this Starbucks and my friends ordered this chocolate drink. Well, a man was going around giving out free samples of the same size. For that, I give this place another star.
author: O K.

description: comes here a lot. great study spot. open 24 hours. line could get pretty long depending time of day. seating could get pretty crowded also.
author: Hector W.

description: is open 24/7 but dirty and homeless people asleep in the cafe :(
author: matt p.

description: I love this location!  The furniture, the space, the staff...and let's not forget the fact that it's open 24 hours!  Yeay!
author: Frangelo A.

description:
24 hour starbucks - what more can you ask for... 

you can find students studying late night here or people just on their laptop in the middle of the night.  This neighborhood is clean and neat.  I was surprised when this starbucks became 24 hours - thought the neighborhood would object to it. 

I used to work on that strip of store and starbucks never failed me.  I've never had problems with the workers here tho there is usually a line when it's a holiday - but i m pretty sure there are other starbucks that gets packed during holidays.
author: Kapo T.

description: 24 hours! I was thrilled to come here and study. It was a break from the library. It was pretty busy when I got here but managed to find a perfect corner spot to study. Everyone working was super friendly.
author: Jasleen K.

description: OH GAWD Strabucks I love and hate this place. 24 hours that's great so when you need a caffeine fix at 4 am when your up studying for finals it's  a good place but it will be something if you find someplace to sit. They place the music way too loud in here do they not have consideration. Young people like to hang out and smoke outside while drinking their drinks. And police officers come here for their caffeine fix. This starbuck has its own culture. Ehh
author: Kristina S.

description: This is the WORST Starbucks I have ever been too. I'm a starbucks addict and go everyday, but I will go out of my way to avoid this one. The first day I went I was the third person in line, but I waited more than 15 minutes for a Chai tea latte. The baristas were too busy talking too make the drinks. I went back a second day and the line was out the door. I finally got to order but I had to wait 15 minutes for my chai tea again. One of the Baristas was instruct 2 others on how to do something, apparently unaware that they were extremely busy. When I finally did get my tea it was made with nonfat milk, which I didn't order. I left it on the bar and walked out. In over ten years of going to starbucks I have never walked out and left my drink. I usual have a good experience with starbucks baristas - they usually pay attention to the customers and give great service. Not at Laurel Heights Starbucks.
author: Puja S.

description: I am generally not a fan of Starbucks.  But, after some exhaustive yelping I discovered that it's one of the few coffee joints in SF that's open the hours I need with decent seating and parking.  So, with much skepticism, I gave it a onceover.  And guess what?  It's great!  Lots of tables and parking, a great mix of people, and a friendly staff to top it off (even after midnight when most people would be falling out of love with the barista lifestyle).  The girl working the register on my second visit actually remembered my name from the night before.  Compared to Palo Alto, where the barista wrote "Annie" on my cup without a second thought, this place is a miracle.
author: Andrew N.

description: This Starbucks is one of the best run businesses I have ever seen.  I told them so when people from Seattle were in the store.  The fact that many of their baristas have been there 3, 4 or even more years says it all.  Not to mention my coffee tastes the same every day.
author: B T.

description: Is the Devil. I drink my coffee black. And they have awful coffee and drive out local business as fast a wal-mart. Boo.
author: Matthew S.

description: really great popel so nice and friendly
author: Ebony B.

description: Open 24hrs a day. Crowded at times. But hey, where else are you going to get some Starbucks coffee in the wee hours of the night!
author: Vance L.

description:
I had this pleasure to work at this store as a "borrowed partner" whenever they needed my help in the mornings/noons. My main store was another 24/7 Starbucks located in SoMa on 9th St @ Howard St.
Effectively on 12/24 I am not a Starbucks employee any longer.

I wanted to thank all the partners I worked with, and all them customers I served. Definitely fruitful 2 years of my life, not to mention very first job I got after moving to USA.

May all of you be healthy, happy and may all your dreams and plans to come true in New Year 2009 !

Thank you so much,
the blue-eyed Tomek aka Tommy the Polish Guy.
author: TOMEK W.

description: A 24 hour Starbucks is always welcome for a random night that needs to be filled by caffeine. My only gripe is the lack of seating - but isn't that the problem with most coffeehouses? Always chock full of students, this one's pretty standard issue, but remains a favorite pit stop.
author: Wally N.

description: This Starbucks is okay.....just too many people and not enough space to accommodate everyone!  Sometimes they burn the coffee and it tastes bitter, then I have to ask for a new brew....ugghhh, I hate burnt coffee first thing in the morning!   They need to get new furniture because those lounge chairs are looking really worn out.  At least it's open late and I can go there for a late night fix!
author: Daria i.

description: I used to go to this Starbucks 3 or 4 times a week to get some work done. There's a lot of seating and plenty of outlets. I also liked that a nice mix of regulars, hospital employees, police officers, locals, and students frequented the place. The last 5 times I've gone, though, the place is PACKED with students only. They've made it their study hall away from school. There's never a seat to be found. They often take up 2 seats because they need a seat for their backpack. I've even watched them bring their own food and drinks and never even order a $2 tea. Or they save seats for friends who don't show up for an hour, while people wander around looking for a place to sit. Lately I walk through, see no seats open, and leave without buying anything. And I've been looking for a new place to frequent because I just don't like the crowd there anymore. What a shame the Peet's just down the strip doesn't stay open later. :(
author: Corrine J.

description: as the only 24 hr starbucks, this place is a great place for me to get my work done.  lots of tables, and lots of competition to get those tables.  so be hungry like a vulture, snag a seat, and hold onto it for dear life.  now get your work done.
author: Dan T.

description: Opens 24 hours, what else can I ask for more..... Parking during the day is bad. Other than that, two thumbs up for the staff at 3595 California.
author: Jimmy T.

description: Nice to have a 24 hour Starbucks near by, but there is never a seat available here whenever I go.
author: Roger R.

description: i go to starbucks once ina while especially when im on my lunch.. (usually only a few ppl in line cause its usually busy) so i was there on my lunch one sunny day. only two ppl in line and whom which one of the co workers knew chit chat for awhile finally i was up next for my order. cashier proceed to glance over at  me a few times and turned around to clean....what the heck???? seriously i was the only one in line... i stood there for a more mins and left... cant believe i got ignored... unaccpectable... disappointed
author: Stephanie S.

description: They do not offer decaf coffee after 12pm. Are they insane!! Your only option is to have them individually brew a cup of decaf for more money. No more Starbucks for me. Peet's is only a short walk.
author: Doug H.

description: Usually, I wouldn't want to support a chain, but this particular Starbucks is outstanding. The comfortable chairs, and Carmen Lundy music really sets the mood. Order something extravagant with a pseudo-name, and you will be pleasantly suprised. Look for the cute barista with candy cane striped socks, and one rolled up pant leg. Beware of the one with blonde hair, tatoos, and black rimmed glasses, he may look cute but really he is a grumpy mini-frap server that interrogates you for laughing at the funny banana flavored mini-fraps. He hates his job, and you, in turn hate him.
author: Bethany D.

description: WOW! nicest and biggest starbucks i've ever seen! they're decor isn't cookie-cutter starbucks either. different art on the walls, cute faux bois pendants, orchids, and wayyy more seating than at a normal starbucks. but you definitely know you're in laurel heights when you see all the babies and yoga-pant-wearing milfs.
author: N. M.

description: 24 hours? i am down with the establishment is all i have to say about this starbucks.
author: Terry S.

description: 5 stars... i used to work here 5 years ago.  it wasnt open 24 hours and they didnt have them ovens.. but the staff there was always fun in the 2 yeras that i worked there.  some of the locals can be downright assholes... so if you crack a smile to the staff, they'll be super nice to you.
author: Doug ..

description: this Starbucks is big and roomy and is opened late.. their customer service is excellent compare to the other Starbucks I went to..I usually go with a small group of friends to get hot chocolate and sit down to chat for awhile.. very relaxing atmosphere...
author: Lily T.

description: First off I am a big Starbucks fan.  I like great coffee and for the most part Starbucks delivers the quintessential American Coffee experience as well as the lifestyle that is sold to the customer.  That is fine with me.  I am not a coffee snob and for what they do they have a good product....for the most part.  There is a reason they are on every street corner.  This Starbucks in particular is what you would expect in this neighborhood...busy...crowded...and full of rich people and their children.  Fine with me, what else do you expect from a Starbucks in Laurel Heights, 24 hour Starbucks nonetheless.  The only problem I have with the Starbucks corporation is the inconsistency in drink making.  You never really know if you are going to get a good drink or not when you go in.  Made correctly you get a good product, but that probability is 50/50.  Most of the time their blended drinks aren't blended enough and for the coffee drinks you get a lot of burnt milk, for that I give it 3 stars.
author: matt g.

description: This is the best starbizzle around cause it's open 24/7.  If you were supposed to do something all day but didn't come here and work until you hate your life.  I must warn you this place may be run by the yakuza b/c I see a lot of them in here.  The breakfast sandwiches taste like the box a frozen pizza comes in.  Sometimes they play decent music which is scary or my taste sucks.
author: Dirk C.
